You didn't go very far from the entrance of the pasture before Zimmerman dumped you here and left, so it stands to reason that the fence should be somewhere close by. you look around slowly, picking out every detail that isn't grass... no, not left... not straight ahead... Ah! there it is! you make out the top of a fence post over the green skyscrapers. with a small sigh of relief, you make your way back down the salt lick and toward the fence. with any luck, you can make it to the stable before nightfall and plan how to get yourself back to normal size.

A newfound sense of awareness and paranoia takes over as you hit the ground. without a clear vision of the fence, your only hope is to make a break for it and pray nothing happens along the way. you start sprinting in the right direction, sliding under roots, hopping along larger grains of sand, and leaping into small crevasses whenever you think you hear a noise. you make sure to always keep your body pointing toward the fence, even if you swivel your head to look around.

it takes roughly an hour and a half, and much of your already low energy reserves, but the same fence post you saw before now looms over you, a monolith larger in diameter than any major building man has constructed. attached to it is a gridwork of thick metal cables thicker even than the hay stalks you encountered at the start of your day. you rest against it for a few minutes to catch a breather before resuming.

immediately on the other side of the fence, the grass becomes far more scattered and shorter. its like the animals that could reach over and eat it did so. sure enough, you spy the head of a grey horse doing just that a safe few miles away. you pick up the pace to get away from it.

as the grass gives way to hard packed dirt, you see the country sized monstrosity of a stable casting a shadow over everything you can see. its red walls and great windows are much more foreboding from the outside. However, you have to get to it, as your life may very well depend on it. the sun is already near the horizon. you'd better hurry.
11133111121113.title: You have a peaceful rest.

choices: you have grown to 1/4 inch or so
You're the same size as before. Nothing has changed...
111331111211131.content:
the sun is already setting by the time you reach the stables. the dirt path was far more difficult to traverse than the grass. countless hoofprint canyons and stinking mountains forced your path to twist and turn with annoying frequency. but, you got here, and that's all that matters right now. Zimmerman brought the last of the large horses in before you got close enough to be in danger, and you waited for him to actually go into his house before proceeding.

you have a bit of deja vu as you poke your head around the corner of the building. this was how your troubles began, albeit a bit larger than you are now. perhaps this can be the beginning of the end.

you walk inside, wary of the hairy behemoths in the surrounding stalls. you head toward the middle of the walkway and try to remember what horse those two strangers were using their device on. it definitely wasn't the paint horse, nor was it the Clydesdale across the path. it must have been the black shire at the far end of the stable. Zimmerman put in a different stall tonight, so it threw you off a bit.

its almost pitch dark when you gaze into the stall, and the terror standing inside it. you keep along the wall, staying as far away as you can from its mall-sized hooves. the last thing you want is another feed bag incident. at its midsection, you sit down on a stalk of hay and wait.

**********

a blinding flash shocks you out of your light sleep. you have just enough time to see the shire horse reduce in size until the hay stalks block it from your view. it is time.

you sprint along stalks of hay to reach it, already with a plan in your head. perhaps if you were latched onto the creature as it grew, the size change would apply to you too. its risky, but your running low on options.

"and... regrow." a voice booms. it would be a mumble to a regular person, but you can hear it just fine. you see a beam of light hit the ground, and the horse regrows almost too fast for you to react. once again, it towers over you, though now tantalizingly close. when it is back to its proper size, its back hoof is only a few hundred feet away.

every part of you wants to go and jump on that hoof now, but you cant. instead, you run past it, under the horses white belly.

"reduce to one inch." the voice orders. another beam of light hits the animal above. you watch as its body rushes down toward you. you don't stop; its do or accept death now. when it stops shrinking, you are able to make it with time to spare. it is in a clear patch of dirt, away from any stalks of hay. the hoof is still closer to triple your height, but its a start. you jump up and latch yourself onto the hoof just in time to hear "and... regrow."

a strange sensation overwhelms you. the air seems warmer and a little easier to breathe. as the light fades, you discretely jump off the hoof and wait. one more of those should get you back to normal, then you'll have to make a break for it. you crouch down in the hay bedding, now up to your waist, and watch the horse shrink again. this time, at about the height you were to it when normal, you place a hand on the animal's flank. you grow again feeling even warmer and full of breath.

you sigh happily, then "what?! how?!" you glance over and see the two men glaring at you, "shoot him again!' one barks. you dive for him, but the beam hits you first. the momentary blindness prevents you from seeing what you land on, but its fleshy and smells of sweat.

"put him back on the horse. we're done for the night." you feel earthquakes, and then you're falling you land hard on a warm surface and lose consciousness from the stress and exertion.

you wake up, sore, and begin to cry openly.
111331111211131.title: you make it into the stable

1113311112111312.content:
As the sun breaks over the distant...brown...shape..., you feel a day's worth of bruises and scratches catch up to you. As you stretch your sore muscles, a rumble underneath shakes you to your core. Remembering your predicament, you look up...and up...and up...

You are sitting underneath a towering spire, easily several times wider than you are tall, and a few hundred feet tall. That looks like those horse hairs you saw before, but much larger. You do some quick math, and figure you're about ten times smaller then you previously were. About 1/500 of an inch. If you were microscopic before, now you were absolutely nanoscopic! You'd be lucky if you could walk a whole foot before getting crushed. The horse you are on top of is a good 30 or 40 miles tall, and just as long. It'd take a day to reach anywhere. As you contemplate your newfound existence, a shadow comes over you. It's...
1113311112111312.title: NANO survivor!

11133111121113121.content:
Looming over you was an enormous alien-like monstrosity that's size surpassed that of mountains! You quickly realize that this gargantuan creature is a mite. You burst into an immediate sprint, running as fast as you can through the strange microscopic terrain of horse hairs that extend endlessly above with the monstrous mite giving chase. Somehow the creature seemed to sense your presence and remained in close pursuit, gaining ground on you with every passing second.

Exhausted, you wonder how much longer your can run, when suddenly the loud booms of the mites movements started to fade and ultimately disappeared. The monstrous microorganism had turned around, and was moving in the opposite direction. Why had it given up the chase? Your question was soon answered, and your relief at escaping the mite quickly turned back to terror when the ground began to quake violently and the shadow of a creature FAR larger than the mite threw you and the entire landscape into darkness. You could not tell what this immense monstrosity was, for it was much too large for you to conceive.

What was this gargantuan beast that had come upon you?
11133111121113121.title: A Mite

choices: The horse flicks its tail, sending you skyward one again
You hit a hair on the horse's leg
11133111121113123.content:
The sky is covered with enormous cables, each the width of a redwood tree and miles long. That's when you notice the roar of wings as a fly a mile away takes off, leaving you directly in the line of fire of the horse's tail. It lands with a BOOM, knocking you off your feet. It doesn't lie still, though. Instead, the hairs begin sliding off the horse's rump just as quickly, sweeping you off as well! You grab onto the nearest one for dear life as you traverse miles in a second. The ground beneath you disappears, replaced with a drop of 30 miles or more. Directly ahead are the legs of the horse, with muscles that could crush you without a care. A distant echo of thunder rumbles as it casually re-positions a single hoof. Other sounds permeate the air: the ear-piercing whinny of a distant horse; the footsteps marching down the hall; the helicopter-like noise as a fly lazily zooms past.

Unfortunately, this hair is too big to hold onto, and you slowly slide down the length. Eventually...
11133111121113123.title: The horses own black tail

111331111211131231.content: You reach the end of the hair, and look down at the fall you're about to take. You plummet for miles, past the entire length of the horse's legs. After a minute of freefall, you land on the sawdust floor. At your size, each chunk of wood was as big as a house. The occasional strand of hay pierces the landscape, stretching hundreds of feet into the air. A mile away, the gargantuan hoof rises above you, stretching higher than even Olympus Mons. The monolithic hoof suddenly ascends, before coming back down once again. The horse is just shifting its weight, but this time you were much closer. The thunderous boom pops your eardrums, and your vision is covered by a cloud of dust particles. Blind and deaf, you don't notice the massive ____ land on you.
111331111211131231.title: Deja Vu

1113311112111312311.content:
Your ears may be shot, but you still feel the earth-shattering boom knocking you to the ground. Your clouded vision is replaced with darkness, and you feel a heavy pressure from above you. The massive object shakes with a rhythmic beat, as the aroma of dirt envelops you. Suddenly, light blinds you as you're lifted in the air. Noticing the ring of metal around you, you realize where you are. The horse's hoof lands down, leaving you in darkness once again. You would have screamed in terror, if you weren't out of energy at this point. Honestly, nothing surprises you now, not even when the horse starts walking. You're brought along for the ride, stuck to some lightly moistened mud under the hoof. At least, you hope it's mud.

Time after time, the hoof ascends and gives you brief view of the floor, before descending and giving you an even closer look. Bored, you spend the time trying to guess where you are. From your limited view of the ground, you can tell you are...
1113311112111312311.title: hoof

11133111121113123112.content:
As the rhythmic ride continues, the brown floor shifts hues to green, with the smell of grass mixing with the dirt. After another minute of walking, the hoof slams down and remains. You notice the mud has dried a bit, allowing you to break free. You decide now is as good a time as any to get off, and jump free of the hoof. You land on a flattened blade of grass, the light returning as the hoof lifts off once again. The grass rises up as well, free from the hoof, and you tumble down to the dirt, dodging grass hairs now as thick as your arm. The massive stalks tower miles into the air, and the smell of grass permeates the area. A massive grasshopper crawls past, too big to even consider you as a snack.

Suddenly, a big boom echos through the air. You look up to see what caused it and see...
11133111121113123112.title: In some grassy field

choices: the cow's underbelly. It walked right over you!
the cow's side, it is walking past you.
111331111211131231122.content:
As you see the head, then the neck, then the chest of a brown behemoth rise over the grass, it becomes clear that your day is only going to get worse. It is so slow now that it appears to be barely moving, but it will still be a huge trek to get safely away from it. Another boom shakes the ground stronger than anything yesterday and motivates you to get your butt moving.

At your new size, individual grains of dirt are huge boulders you have to leap from, and the nearest blade of grass it like a hundred feet away! With each jump you fall a little further into despair. No one will find you, no matter how hard they look. Not even your remains.

A third boom throws you off balance, and you stumble onto a tiny stone. You look back and see…
111331111211131231122.title: A cow walking towards you

choices: A calf appears, wanting some milk
1113311112111312311222.content: The titanic cow looms above you, blocking out the sun. Miles away, an enormous maw lowers to the ground behind you and grabs millions of tons of grass. You thank your lucky stars you weren't over there: you couldn't outrun molasses at this size. However, you're not as safe as you think, as...
1113311112111312311222.title: Under the cow

111331111211131232.content:
Your already strained grip on the hair is put to the test as the entire tail flicks again. The horses flank rushes past you at blinding speeds, then you see over the top of its back. The stable now is so vast that even the horse in the next stall is only a blur of color and minor motion. Your hopes of ever growing back, or even surviving much longer, begin to dwindle.

The tail moves impossibly fast once again, flicking back down and breaking your grip. you find yourself suspended, flying away by the current of displaced air of the tail. You sail through the air, with every little draft changing your direction. Had you been normal sized, these air currently would not even have been felt: A fly shoots past you and the gale in it's wake carried you abruptly in the opposite direction. The horse turning its own head, even though you are still at the opposite end of its body, pushes you back toward its tail once more. Through all of this, you are still descending, albeit very slowly. Unfortunately, flying around without control doesn't really allow you to see where you are going. You eventually land on...
111331111211131232.title: The horse flicks its tail, sending you skyward ...

1113311112111312322.content: The ground you are on feels cold, sapping the heat from your body. You quickly jump up, and survey your surroundings. You're standing on a large, glass field. Odd shapes fill the area, made of bits of metal and electronic equipment. That's when you realize you are on that device those men were using: maybe you can grow back! As you take a step, the floor beneath you lights up. Apparently it's a touch screen, sensitive enough to register you. Another screen lights up next to you, showing a timer. Maybe you can jump in the barrel and get back to normal size! You don't have time to check if it's set the right way, so you'll just have to take that risk. As you sprint across the shrink ray, you hear coils and capacitors whine as they charge and discharge. Do you make it in front of the ray?
1113311112111312322.title: A metallic device?

11133111121113123221.content:
You reach the tip, and carefully lower yourself inside the barrel. As you hit the floor, the interior lights up as a beam hits you from inside the device. You black out once again, hoping this will bring you back to your old size.

Meanwhile, Zimmerman had entered the stable and noticed the flash of light. He finds a chrome device, about the size and shape of a handgun. On the side was an LED screen that read, "100x". Thinking it to be a toy, he pockets the device and returns to his house. Unbeknownst to him, you were inside that stable when he entered. The blast from the device knocked you free of the device and onto the floor. As you wake up, you find yourself...
11133111121113123221.title: Yes

choices: A miles-long hair on the horse's leg
A speck of dirt just outside the stall
111331111211131232212.content: The area looks...odd. You can feel something massive is nearby, but don't see any movement or hear anything. Ahead of you is a field of beige tubes, each miles tall and spread out even longer than that. Behind you, miles away, is a brown pillar hundreds of miles in width, and stretching up to eternity. You can't see any other landmarks or locations; the rest of the area is a blur. Suddenly you realize what you are looking at: a bed of hay ahead of you, and the single hoof of a planet-sized horse. It's clear, even from this size, that the leg and hoof are too thick to belong to that paint horse; this must be the Clydesdale you saw yesterday! You succumb to a panic attack to beat all others. You're so small, even a flea would be miles tall to you. You'd be lucky to ever reach safety: an ant could crush you and never notice. This is it, there's no way you could find a way out of this. The continental horse moves its hoof, re-positioning it much closer to you. Interestingly enough, there's no noise but instead an earthquake that sends you flying hundreds of feet into the air, just high enough to get hit by the blast of air from the movement. You helplessly fly through the air, unable to avoid whatever it was you were about to land on.
111331111211131232212.title: Nanoscopic!

1113311112111312322121.content: A massive wall of brown appears, and you instinctively reach out. However, it grows in size, and you land hard on its surface. What was once a handhold is now as wide as an aircraft carrier, and stretched miles in either direction. Far off in the distance, the vague blob shape of the world moves. You're probably on the leg of Planet Horse. From here, you've either got an endless fall to the ground, or a year-long journey up the leg. So you can either abandon the horse, or stay on and hope for the best.
1113311112111312322121.title: A miles-long hair on the horse's leg

choices: Zimmerman! (You are lost on his body)
A field of grass! (You are lost in a galaxy-sized expanse of grass)
11133111121113123221211.content: Breathing deeply, you make your decision. You don't want to spend the rest of your short life (pun intended) lost on this planetary steed. You decided it was time to jump. That was probably your best option for survival. You took a few minutes to walk along one of the colossal hairs, then peered over the edge. The world outside of Planet Horse seemed warped and unrecognizable, due to it being blown way out of proportion. There was no way of telling where you could possibly end up. Yet you took one more relaxed breath (though your heart was practically beating our of your chest) and leaped out into the oblivion. You screamed as winds swept you across the horizon and far away from Planet Horse, which seemed much smaller now, even though you were only 2 inches from your previous spot. Another thing you couldn't possibly have realized was that the Clydesdale had been standing next to...
11133111121113123221211.title: Forge your own path

11133111121113123221212.content:
You spend an eternity climbing the horse's leg. Any motion the horse makes is so massive, and you are so small, that you aren't even affected. However, you're still terrified every time a fly the size of Rhode Island crawls past. You survive off of skin flakes and sweat; a terrible existence, but better than death (or so you still think). Days turn into months, and months into...honestly, you've lost track of time. All you know is that you've spent all this time climbing the planetary creature you were stuck on. You eventually reach the top, and see the horse's massive head in the distance: another month-long journey. You get a sense of deja vu, then remember when you were last here. At least back then you were big enough that you could get off the horse in a day. That sense of deja vu only intensifies when a shadow looms over you. It's....it's...

Another fly. The damn things are louder than helicopters, and even though they don't notice you, their massive legs are still a concern. The behemoth settles above you, and a thousand foot long proboscis lands just ahead of you. The fly slowly crawls forward, but you know that even the massive insect is the least of your concerns. As long as it's here, it could alert the...horse...

The sun is blocked by a tangle of hairs that could destroy the United States with a single blow. The fly, sensing danger, takes off to avoid the horse's tail. You don't get that option, and instead hold your arms out as the tail approaches. A single hair is almost invisible at a normal size; now, this single hair will crush you like an asteroid.

The bloody spot wasn't big enough to notice, nor did the horse even feel your death. Zimmerman never did find out what happened to you. That's a shame, he really appreciated your efforts.
11133111121113123221212.title: Staying with Planet Horse

1113311112111312322122.content:
The ground is thick, hard, and green. The smooth surface continues in every direction for miles, only to be continued by another massive green mountain. The smell of grass permeates the air. You don't recognize the view until the maw of a planetary horse looms overhead. The lips part to show teeth that could crush Europe in a single bite, along with an ocean of saliva.

As the maw nears closer, you run as fast as your legs could carry you. Of course, your fastest speed couldn't outrun a snail, much less a hungry horse. The lips descend around you, and a thick tongue lifts you and a dozen bits of greenery into the mouth. You're tossed around with absolutely no control, just waiting for death to take you.
1113311112111312322122.title: Alfalfa Island

11133111121113123221222.content:
By some incredible luck, when a Rhode Island-sized tooth smashed your alfalfa island to smithereens, you were small enough to be whisked out of Planet Horse’s maw by a minuscule gust of wind. As you begin a very long descent, some other bits of seed also spray out from the animal’s sloppy eating and join you. This would not have been an issue if some of the seed pieces weren’t the size of New York City! You scream and try changing your trajectory enough to avoid getting crushed by the supermassive shrapnel. You, fortunately, dodge a few but eventually get smacked by a mote-sized seed slice large enough to be an apartment. The alfalfa piece pins you down and carries you somewhere else on the horse’s seemingly infinite body.


Where else on Planet Horse will you get a microbial excursion?
11133111121113123221222.title: Somehow, you manage to survive.

choices: Start heading back to the horses head. Take higher ground!
Start by avoiding the giant leather strap approaching!
What is that giant cave further back on the horse?
111331111211131232212222.content:
A seed too small to be noticed by anyone sails through the air, beneath the horses massive body. The horse is oblivious as it devours its meal, knickering happily with each bite. Its tail flicks absently behind it and it moves its hind legs a bit to adjust itself and eat more.

If the seed went unnoticed, then there was absolutely no hope for you to be spotted, or heard, or felt, or perceived in anyway at all. You flew through the air, holding onto an alfalfa seed as large as a suburb. Wind screamed past you and tested your hand strength to its limits.

The seed gently brushed against the shire's underbelly, creating not even a tickle before settling back down toward the hay-strewn floor.

You hit something massive and dark, with enough force to rip you off the seed. You launch forward and land hard on a warm surface and roll even harder. Slowly, you get to your feet and look around, to a very bizarre spectacle: two truly massive black spires rise up into the hay covered... sky? That doesn't seem right. You look behind you and find a thick forest of black hair, which also houses two great pillars. Then it hits you, though you do a handstand to make sure. Yep, you're standing on the horses underbelly, closer to its rear than its chest. You're so puny that the animals own gravity is enough to hold you. You are literally on a living, walking, equine planet.

What the heck are you gonna do now?!
111331111211131232212222.title: An upside-down tundra (its underbelly)

choices: Up the massive ears for higher ground
Down onto the nose, almost no hair to obstruct your view
1113311112111312322122221.content:
After the realization that you are on a new living planet you think of how it's impossible for anyone that can help, will ever detect you. A flea on the horse alone is a few city blocks to you. Thinking about this you realize that your best plan is to get to a vantage point and try to find a way back to the shrink ray and hope you can grow yourself back this time. You decide the head is the best vantage point and start the enormously long walk. You don't know how long you walk but you don't find yourself getting hungry or thirsty and hope that lasts for the rest of your journey.

Finally after rounding the belly up onto the back and walking along the back, the ground starts to significantly slant upwards. Then soon after that the already enormous hairs grow taller and taller blocking out the light. It takes you another day or two to get through the mane but finally you see two gargantuan ears on either side of you. You run towards them and you can now see the whole galaxy of the stable. You decide that you should then go....
1113311112111312322122221.title: a better vantage point

choices: Go inside the sheath, you need some shelter
1113311112111312322122223.content:
Bewildered by the fact that this horse had seemingly become your new universe, you were a bit too surprised to thing very rationally. As such, when you saw the gigantic... thing about a mile away, you couldn't help but wonder what it could be. You couldn't really tell where you were on this beast, so you figured getting some vantage point would be helpful. And so, you began the long journey along the horse's underbelly, hoping to get to this landmark in the forest of hairs.

About half an hour of walking later, you arrive. With a start, you realized that you were near the equine's immense, monolithic sheath. The rubbery flesh stretches before you, ending in two massive orbs hanging miles below. A thick musky scent fills the area, making it hard to breath. With every step your new world takes, his crotch jiggles slightly, which makes for a massive earthquake each time. Now what?
1113311112111312322122223.title: A Giant Cave?

choices: The ground is much hotter than it felt when you went to sleep
you can't see anything, you either slipped deeper or it's night.
11133111121113123221222231.content:
The ground quakes, you are tossed about by the jiggling. You hit a hair and grab on with all your might, but even then you are nearly thrown off. With the quaking coming to a stop temporarily you need to get somewhere safe and you run to the closest shelter, the horses immense sheath.

As you get closer the true size of this animal starts to make your head hurt, it didn't help that you haven't rested in hours. You need to take a break, you're tired and your legs burn, but you can't stop now. Another step by this universal horse could send you floating off in the breeze never to touch solid ground again.

you're almost to the opening of the sheath and you put in one last burst of speed. You enter the vast cavern, just as the horse starts moving again. You're too exhausted to explore right now, you sit down and sleep comes quickly. When you awake the first thing you notice is...
11133111121113123221222231.title: Go inside the sheath, you need some shelter

choices: Left.  Only to discover the horse has been shrunken again, and you with it.
Right, staggering deeper and deeper into the horse's sheath.
111331111211131232212222312.content:
The horse't thundering heartbeat was all you could hear when you stirred awake, the darkness so intense you literally couldn't see your hand in front of your face. Staggering forwards, the dank, musk laden smell of the horse's cock choking the air, you manuvered your way in the dark, tripping and stumbling over . . .well. . you didn't know what. Germs? Amoeba? The concept of scale had left your mind spinning and, you were getting dizzy with hunger, the fact that anything about this situation made you think of food was testament to just how hungry you were. It's been three days, already, since you've had a bite to eat or a drink and lord knows when you'll get one again. Or if.

But that's hardly your biggest concern at this instant.

A whinny from the horse shook you to your senses. The low rumble of someone speaking in response took you a bit off guard as you staggered forwards still, the voice incomprehensible at both this size and muffled through the walls of the sheath you were currently in.

A sharp pain staggered you again as you ran face first into a . . .wall? A hair? Something, whatever it was, blocked your path. Your choice was simple now, as things spiraled out of control. Do you go left? Or right?
111331111211131232212222312.title: Pitch Black

choices: Hide!  This was far too dangerous as it was.
Realize the man was somehow staring right. At. You.  They were looking for you!
1113311112111312322122223121.content:
You blinked the tears from your eyes as you began seeing motes of light from beyond the 'cavern' entrance, wiping the stinging beads of musk laden moisture from your face. You were limping now, from the constant tripping and staggering, uncertain why the horse was suddenly moving so much, it's every motion a world-rocking earthquake to you.

Finally, you found yourself at the edge of the sheath, looking downwards in confusion.

The ground beneath the horse had been replaced, the dirt, hay littered floor of the stall was a strange white surface, the horse's hooves dimpling and straining whatever the material was. Scanning to the right and left, you couldn't see the source of that mysterious voice you'd heard, only the off white ground, stretching off far beyond your admittedly limited visual range.

Then something moved. Four mountains began to rise past the horizon, rapidly arching past the horse's form and high into the sky, the sound of creaking rubber echoing through the night as the horse whinnied again. Again you heard that low rumble of a voice, so deep and sonorous it was impossible to make out what was being said. . . but you'd already figured it out, hadn't you? You just didn't want to admit it.

This horse, that was your entire universe, was standing in the middle of a gloved hand, it's mighty hooves unable to even puncture the 'thin' layer of latex it stood upon. Still, this is the closest you've ever been to the visitors. Aliens. Whatever they were.

They had the device. They were your only hope of ever getting back to size.
1113311112111312322122223121.title: Left.

choices: Zimmerman's foot land near you, sending you careening through the air!
Zimmerman's niece Olivia steps on you with her barefoot sole!
1113311112111312322123.content: You finally land on a misshapen, planet-like sphere of brown. All the world around you is a strange, almost hallucinogenic blur. You can't believe how small you are; you can't even see the other side of this piece of dirt! You spend a day or two hiking around the piece on dirt to look for something to just barely pass off as food, while cowering from tremors and noises that were simply insects crawling along. Eventually, you awaken to an earthquake the likes of which dwarfed the ones you had felt earlier. A darkness looms over you, and you see a figure so large it blocks out the sun. A figure so large, yet you can still tell what it is. Despite being exhausted out of your mind (you got very little sleep with the deafening songs of crickets) your nanoscopic body is filled with adrenaline and fear as a colossal foot shots out toward your insignificant land. You scream as...
1113311112111312322123.title: Downsized and Dirty

11133111121113123222.content: You're right on top of the barrel as a beam of light shoots out. You sigh in defeat, and watch the beam hit something ahead of you. You watch it shrink, now thankful that you weren't in front of the beam. What got hit, anyway?
11133111121113123222.title: No

111331111211131232221.content:
At the last second you realize that the beam had hit none other than Zimmerman! Leaning over the edge, you try to find the now minuscule farmer. He must be around your size, you can't even find him! You make a running jump off the wall: you know you can survive the fall, just need to find a man smaller than a needle on a floor covered in hay. Hmm, that analogy seemed a bit clunky.

After several minutes, you eventually reach the ground with a rough, although harmless landing. You're back in a field of straw, only now it's bigger than any man-made object, standing hundreds of feet tall and several miles long. And that's just one single stalk: you have a whole floor to search! You do take a moment to thank your lucky stars that there isn't a horse in here. After a few hours of wandering, you finally see Zimmerman in the distance. He appears to be pacing back and forth beside a straw triple his height. It's hard to judge scale from a distance, but getting closer you can figure that you're about the size of his shoe. You jump, swing your arms in the air, and scream his name. Does he notice you?
111331111211131232221.title: Another shrunk in the dust

1113311112111312322212.content: The tiny farmer is too preoccupied with himself to notice your even tinier form nearby. In frustration Zimmerman yells to no one in particular and kicks about the microscopic dust. You refrain from getting any closer and decide to just watch him from a distance. Of course, that distance is a mere half inch. Unfortunately for him, he was still big enough to be noticed by the giant creatures nearby. Unfortunately for you, any such a creature would also unknowingly find you as well. The ground shakes as one such curious titan approaches, and the muzzle of an enormous ___ looms above the two of you
1113311112111312322212.title: No

choices: Get back to the shrink ray!
The horse's nose is coming back!
11133111121113123222121.content:
Zimmerman had been preparing to take his horses out to pasture when the beam hit. Too fast for the horse in front of him to register, the man shrank, practically disappearing. When Zimmerman began screaming for help, the Clydesdale again found him.

A dark shadow darkened the world around you as a brown muzzle bigger than... huh... Everest? Maybe? Sure. Bigger than Mount Everest descends toward the both of you curiously. You, being more accustomed to your size, bolt, hiding behind and practically under one of the scyscraping stalks of hay nearby. You hear a deep boom, followed by a powerful gale of wind hitting the earth. You peek out and see Zimmerman reaching up and lightly touching the horses nose. He is between the nostrils, and mostly safe from its sniffing. Then, the unimaginable happens:

One moment Zimmerman is there, the next, he is being grabbed by the clydesdales prehensile lips and lifted into the air. Nothing more is seen of him but a few pieces of hay that were grabbed as well. You watch in horror as the horse brings its head back up and begins chewing slowly. "Maybe it will spit him out? Maybe it will-" the horse quickly swallows. You watch the small Bulge travel down its neck and disappear. "Oh..." is all you can say to that.
11133111121113123222121.title: horse

choices: Go perpendicular to the tail. Be curious...
111331111211131233.content:
No matter how tightly you grip the hair, you still slide down. Perhaps "grip" isn't the proper term: this hair is so large that it is all you can do to straddle it. Imagine wrapping yourself around a tree as it sways in the breeze. You do not let go, of course, but you are, in fact, descending.

However, perhaps fate, in all its torture of you thus far, decided to throw you a bone. You hear a loud creaking, like the hull of a ship, and turn your head to see its source. You scream as a brown wall rushes toward you, reaching you too quickly to adjust your hold on the tail, jump, or do anything productive. The wall grows more clear as it comes closer, and you make out hairs only slightly thinner than the one you hold covering it. You wince as it hits and rips you away from the tail.

Your fall through the hairs to the floor was a bit painful, but you have survived with all your bones not broken. You stand up and arch your back, feeling and hearing a few pops along your spine. These hairs all rise into the air and bend in a uniform direction, blocking out most of the light. What filters through is bleak and lacking in real illumination. The floor is rough and craggy, and covered in moderately sized, somewhat transparent hills. Were you back on the horse? Had that imperceptibly massive wall been just its leg, stepping backward? You push the thought away and calm yourself. Thankfully, you are so small that the horse holds you with its own gravity, so despite being vertical in a grand sense, you can still walk just fine.

A shadow passes above you and you duck to avoid detection from whatever it is. Looking up, you see a great black cloud, made of gigantic cables, rushing past. It moves back the opposite way and stops above you. "The tail," you murmur. "Welp... no point in standing around," talking is about the only thing that will keep you sane right now.
111331111211131233.title: Leg for days!

choices: Take a break. Climb up a hair and view the world.
Keep walking. You've come too far to stop now.
1113311112111312331.content:
You decide that walking parallel to the planet's tail can only lead upward, which is safe, or down, so you start walking. Each hair is a hundred or so feet apart from one another, so, doing the math, you figure that getting anywhere will take... for freaking ever! It takes you a full minute just to get to the next hair, and there are too many to count on a single leg of this beast!

Then, because you are, in fact, on a living creature, you feel a rumble deep under the ground you walk on. The air begins to feel a little different, and you speed up to the next hair. No sooner had you reached it, an earth shattering quake shakes you off your feet, or it would if you didn't have the hair to support you.

---

Zimmerman entered the stable and immediately set to taking all the horses out to graze for the day, like he always did. He began with his favorite of his big boys, a brown Clydesdale his niece had named titan due to his size. Zimmerman put in the bridle and bit and led titan out of the stable and through the nearby gate into the pasture. The bridle had not been removed for more than a second before it walked away, and Zimmerman marveled at the muscled hind legs, jiggling slightly with each step. He was quite a powerful creature indeed. With a contented sigh, Zimmerman turned and went back to the stable to get another horse.

---

Unbeknownst to you, because you were just too small to quickly connect the dots, titan the Clydesdale was the horse on which you were currently traversing. After four steps, chaotic and traumatic as they were, you find a pattern in the earthquakes. The aftershocks of the tremors are not strong enough to knock you off your feet, so the moment they start, you make a beeline to the next hair. The aftershocks wobble and make you run like someone who had had way too many drinks, but you could at least get there.

Too many earthquakes to count later, and they finally slow down to an infrequent and unpredictable number, allowing you to both calm down, and make the connection that the hell you experienced was just the horse walking. "I hope it's done with that for a while," you grumble, starting a light jog. Through all of that, the sky above shifted and brightened, though you had no idea where the horse went; the images you saw through the hairs were so blurry and misshapen that you stopped worrying about it.
1113311112111312331.title: Titan

choices: Go under! Dig and stay hidden!
111331111211132.content:
Because luck is simply NOT on your side today, something is blocking your path to the stable. As you approach the red building, a long tube as tall as an apartment building stretches off as far as you can see in either direction. Of course Zimmerman would leave the hose out in the exact place you needed to be! A small lattice of plastic tube it too long to simply go around and make it in a reasonable time, so you'll either have to brave climbing over it, or find some way beneath it. Well, at least there's no animals now...
Right?
111331111211132.title: something blocks your path

choices: Zimmerman is sitting on his couch shirtless watching TV
He is in the forest taking his dog for a walk
He is tending to one of his other animals.
1113311112112.content: You land hard on the dark fabric of the giant cotton plaid shirt that Zimmerman is wearing. You start to fall down the fabric. it isn't long, however, before luck throws you a bone: you land in a tiny wrinkle in the shirt that acts like a slide to you and you slide down towards the buttons of his shirt. the crease levels out right in the middle of the shirt, near the buttoned up edge. You decide it would be safer inside the shirt so you climb around the edge and inside. The farmer has giant abs that now look like mountains. your arms are starting to get tired and you see his belly button is right there. it might be a bit gross to think about, but you cant afford to be picky. you decide you might as well rest somewhere you'll be safe. at Zimmerman's next step, the shirt us pulled close enough to the belly button to jump inside. you stumble a little, but keep your footing. it is like a cave you could now fit a house in, you lie down against the wall of skin and let the soothing noise of his breath lull you to sleep. You wake up to find...
1113311112112.title: A living cave

1113311112113.content: As you plummet, a great, dark mass drops below and stops directly under you. Zimmerman had let the feed bag swing back down in his grip. It rises up around you as you fall into its depths, and just before you land, he starts moving again. The bag wall rushes toward you and SMACK! Hits you full on. The motion pins you to it, then suddenly doesn't. In fact, you are flying back and SMACK! Your back hits the other side. Over and over this happens, until it dawns on you that Zimmerman is swinging the bag back and forth as he walks. The light above you Simms slightly and you look up to see the rafters of the stable once again.
1113311112113.title: Back into the feed bag as it is righted

choices: Second time's the charm. Start climbin'!
A horse is messing with the bag curiously
11133111121132.content: Gravity holds you to the bottom of the bag as it is lifted up and placed on a high nail between two of the horse stalls, one of which is occupied. You sit up and shake away the motion sickness threatening to make you puke.looking up, the rafters are significantly closer, which means your trek back to the ground, or anywhere for that matter, will be significantly longer.
11133111121132.title: Zimmerman hangs up the bag

choices: It smells the bag! Take cover!
It isn't interested. Climb the post behind you.
111331111211321.content:
For the second time in an hour, you have little time but to ascend a mesh wall as high as a skyscraper. With a heavy sigh, and a gag at the overpowering stanch of alfalfa, you make your way past stalks and seeds to the side of the bag.

After nearly half an hour of nonstop climbing, your arms are in fire, but you are finally atop the lip of the bag, surveying the stable from your high vantage point. Zimmerman had already taken most of the horses out to the pasture by now, but There is a grey Shire horse to your right. You aren't all that worried; it couldn't possibly notice you. Could it?
111331111211321.title: Second time's the charm. Start climbin'!

choices: Th horse is satisfied. Its tongue descends toward you!
The horse keeps sniffing, pulling you into the air!
The horse knocked the bag into the ground!
111331111211322.content:
The horse, a grey shire, watched as Zimmerman entered the stable and placed the feeding bag on a nail near the horses head. It waited until Zimmerman left to see if there was anything left inside that it could eat. It nudged at the bag, making it swing until it could reach its muzzle in and sniff around inside it.

You sit up and wait for the severe dizziness to subside. Thankfully, it doesn't take long, and you start to make your way to the bag wall to climb back up through the same hole you found earlier. You maneuver past small bits of uneaten alfalfa, each as large as a car at least, and a full sized bus at most.
Suddenly, the whole bag lurches to the side violently. Again, you start rolling to the side of the bag, along with a few of the green stalks. Just as quickly, the bag tilts in the opposite direction, sending you sliding with even more pieces of alfalfa. With each dramatic tilt, the angle of the bag becomes slightly more horizontal, until it abruptly stops. You, and now the majority of the alfalfa crumbs, now rest in a pile at the corner of the bag a few pieces hold you down, but with some effort you manage to free yourself. The bag grows darker and you look up in terror. A great black muzzle, half a mile wide, it slowly pushing toward you. It begins to sniff, and you feel the air pressure changing around you!
111331111211322.title: A horse is messing with the bag curiously

1113311112113222.content: The horse sniffs at the contents of the bag, and you feel yourself starting to be pulled upward. Before you leave the ground, a great gale of hot air blasts the bag and sends the alfalfa in all directions. Car-sized stalk pieces shoot everywhere, thankfully not hitting you, but it still launched you up slightly. The nostrils again sniff, and now you are ascending at a frightening speed. Do you go up, or out?
1113311112113222.title: The horse keeps sniffing, pulling you into the ...

choices: You make it to the bottom
111331111212.content:
As you are getting to your feet, the entire bag heaves forward, throwing you onto one of the giant alfalfa stalks. The gravity seems to multiply and pin you down. You look up in shock and immediately regret it: you see two male hands holding up a black strap of the bag over you, and a moment later, you see the paint horses colossal brown muzzle cast a shadow over you. You let out a terrified scream as it descends toward you, lips already parting. Desperately, you start jumping down deeper into the bag, hopping from one alfalfa stalk to the next. The light grows even more dim and the bag shudders again. You lose your footing briefly and tumble down a few pieces, but you regain yourself. Your surroundings get a little brighter as the first bite is taken, you steal a glance over your shoulder and can easily make out one cavernous nostril. You hear the deafening sounds of the alfalfa being pulverized inside the horses mouth. If you don't keep going, you'll be there too.
Are you fast enough?
111331111212.title: No chance, it's feeding time already!

choices: A muddy path near the barn
1113311112121.content:
As the bottom of the bag nears ever closer, you hazard a glance upward. Lucky for you, you manage to duck as a monstrous pair of lips close just above your head, collecting literal tons (well, to you) of alfalfa at once. You finally step down to the cloth floor, and notice a massive hole..again, massive to you. A single stalk of alfalfa couldn't get through, and most people wouldn't even realize there was a hole in the first place. Thankfully, you are not most people, and much smaller than them. The bright light coming through makes it hard to see what's on the other side, but anything has to be better than the hellhole you're in. You jump.

Of course, you failed to realize that if the horse had his feedbag on, he's out and about. Where do you end up?
1113311112121.title: You make it to the bottom

11133111121211.content:
Leaping through the hole, your eyes adjust to the outside light and your realize you're outdoors. A red wall too large for words stands over your left shoulder, and a maze of fences lay to the right. Looking ahead, you see you're on a path that walks around this barn and continues onward for some time. Behind, four massive pillars slowly tread forward, still oblivious to your pathetic plight. Sighing, you finally look down in time to watch the brown landscape rush up. Flailing your arms, you finally collide with the mud on your back. Thankfully, the mud was soft enough to absorb your fall, so all you have to show for a multi-mile fall is getting the wind knocked out of you.

You only get a split second to take a breath as you watch the horse's frame hover over you. One of its hind legs lifts up, and a hoof larger than a city block moves a bit too close. Just as quickly as it was lifted, the hoof descends right in front of you, forming a crater in the mud with you on the ridge. You once again are thankful for the mud, as this time you aren't blasted who knows where, but instead watch as the hoof lifts up again and travels a good mile before settling down again. The horse has departed.

You get up, and try to shake what excess mud is still on you. Now you've got a few options: take the path or enter the pens. You have no idea which would be a safer route, and you also have no idea where exactly you want to end up. You could also just head back to the stable. It's definitely got horses inside, but at least you know what's coming.
11133111121211.title: A muddy path near the barn

choices: You get a chance to find out: Zimmerman is walking towards you!
A shadow in the sky descends toward you!
111331111212111.content:
You begin to walk ahead. It's hard to judge the distance traveled, but you know that it would take all day to move just a few feet. As a result, you get a few hours to think to yourself.

Who were those two men? What were they doing with that device? Are they coming back? You don't really know the answer to any of this. What should you do now? Is there any way you could get Zimmerman's attention at this size? Could he even see or hear you, much less recognize you? If he can't, what hope do you have of getting rescued?
111331111212111.title: Take the path

1113311112121112.content:
You continue down the muddy path, and take in what your senses find. The earthy smell of the dirt, the faraway sound of chirping, the shadow and flash of blue overhead, the new hurricane of wind, the rumbling earthquake that sends you prone.

You get back up, and are face to face with a pair of scaly, monstrous feet. Your crane your neck further up to see you are face to face-make that face to foot-with a blue jay. This is the smallest animal you've met, but even then it's nearly 3/4 of a mile tall. It chirps again: to a passerby this would be seen as a beautiful call, to you it's the ear-piercing shriek of Godzilla. Suddenly, you notice a massive ant nearby. It appears the blue jay noticed it as well, as a massive beak flies down from the heavens, snatches the morsel, then just as quickly returns to its original position. That ant was a dozen times your size, yet it didn't stand a chance. You're doomed if the blue jay notices you. Does it?
1113311112121112.title: The Blue Jay

11133111121211121.content:
The bird's head swivels, and you feel like its massive eye is locked right on you. Before you can move, a massive beak swings down and snatches you, crushing your right arm and leg. You don't have any time to cry out in pain, as the blue jay tosses your body down its throat. You bounce down the esophagus, before melting in an instant in the bird's stomach.

The next day, Zimmerman will finally see you, but in the form of a dropping on his newly-washed truck.
11133111121211121.title: Yes

11133111121212.content:
As you leap into the hole, a hurricane-force gust of wind sucks you away from the horse and lifts you high up in the air. The horse was wandering about in a large field, and you're now soaring high above it. You can see the blurry shapes of what you guess are other farm animals enjoying their time outside: other horses, cows, goats, and a few sheep are probably nearby.

After a terrifying few minutes of speeding through the air, the wind finally dies down enough for you to land on...
11133111121212.title: A grassy field

111331111212121.content:
You fly towards one of the monolithic animals. A white blur soon becomes a white sheep, and that white sheep becomes a white jungle. Soon enough, you land in a tangle of enormous wool. Great white trees rise up from the pink ground, and seem to spiral all around you. It's so thick, you can't see anything but the giant spires. You've got no idea what part of the sheep you're on, or in what direction you should go. Well, let's try...this way.

No, wait, this way.
111331111212121.title: A white world

choices: A denizen of this land (a flea or mite)
A pair of hand shears (the sheep is getting sheared!)
1113311112121212.content: The ground beneath you rumbles. You hear a noise behind you, and turn around to see...
1113311112121212.title: Another earthquake...

11133111121212122.content: Your hear an odd mixture of metallic squeals, crashing noises, and a deafening hum. Behind you, a pair of metal poles glide over the sheep's skin, shearing off the wool and revealing the skin underneath. This is really bad. You start to run. It seems no matter which direction you pick, the shears always end up right behind or in front of you. You know this game won't last forever, sooner or later the massive machine will tear through the forest and shred you to even more microscopic bits.
11133111121212122.title: A pair of hand shears (the sheep is getting she...

111331111212121222.content:
The hum reaches a crescendo, and you watch as the metal blades grow closer and closer. Raking back and forth, they easily cut through the thick wool of the sheep. Sure enough, you provide absolutely no resistance as the blades eviscerate you, smearing the tiniest speck of blood across the machine.

Zimmerman never did find out what happened to you, and after cleaning the shears he never will.
111331111212121222.title: The shears approach...

111331111212122.content: The green floor starts to get closer. As you approach, the individual stalks of grass become visible, and soon enough one starts to fill your view. You slam into the blade, and quickly recovering grab on. The 6 inch green tower looks like it's half a mile tall to you, and you're near the top. The grass begins to sway back and forth in the wind, which is making you sick. You should probably get down soon.
111331111212122.title: The grass

1113311112121221.content:
From your vantage point, any manmade structure is thousands of miles away, barely visible against the blur of everything else in the distance. You have to get back, and that means you can't just stay on a blade of grass for the rest of your life, especially not one in the middle of a pasture full of animals that dwarf the highest mountains. You notice many indistinct shapes slowly walking along the grass before you start to descend, which is plenty concerning.

Even being so small, the hairs of the grass give slightly under you, but not enough that you fall. You hop from one to the other all the way down to the ground. You finally jump down onto what has to be a single grain of dirt and realize that there's no way you are going to get anywhere without help, dangerous as that will be.

The grass prevents you from seeing anything in front of you, and you have to crane your neck to see the world above. You keep true to the direction of Zimmerman's house, but it takes over an hour for you to boulder hop the dirt grains a couple of inches. At least there's plenty of shade.
1113311112121221.title: Start sliding down the blade

choices: You fall out of the mouth
1113311112121222.content: For the second time today you watch in fear as a mouth as big as a mountain moves towards you. From the quick glance you got at the nose, it's a cow. The jaws part, and a ring of teeth position themselves around you. They close, and a few dozen blades of grass (including the one you're on) are torn out of the ground. Your blade collapses onto the pink monster that is the tongue. Soon enough the mouth is lifted up, and the jaws start to chew. What happens to you?
1113311112121222.title: A monstrous maw looms overhead...

11133111121212221.content: There really was no hope for you. Your puny body flew about the cow's mouth, before landing on one of the enormous molars. You try to move again, but are caught in a tiny patch of plaque.. Everything seems to move in slow motion as you rise up towards the molar above you. It crushes you instantly, leaving a splat of red on the molar. Your demise is quickly washed away from a wave of saliva, before all the evidence flowed down the cow's throat.
11133111121212221.title: You get eaten

choices: You make it out when the cud gets to the mouth
You fail to escape you’re swallowed again and digested
you are chewed with the cud
11133111121212222.content:
You lay among the blades of grass on the cows rubbery tongue. You’re frozen in place as you still don’t believe where you are. The only thing that snaps you out of your daze is the tongue starts to move and you are tossed and and rolled around as it began to chew the grass lazily. You where rolled onto a molar but managed to get free. The tooth only grazed your back as it came down. You fell with a splat into a saliva covered pile of grass.

The saliva was thick and hard to maneuver though as you tried to get to the front and escape. Even if you fell and died on the ground it was better then being eaten alive by the cow. You finally make it and try to time the jump with her opening her mouth to chew.

Just as you start to jump the tongue curls up and slaps you into a pile of chewed up grass. You stick to the pile due to all the saliva and scream as the tongue rises up making the pile and you slide towards its throat. Which a loud deafening “Gulp!” You are pulled into the cows throat as she reaches down to eat another pile of grass. The throat constricted around you pulling you towards the first stomach. You hit a stop and are confused till suddenly it opens up and you free fall into a mass of grass.

You made it this far. Your in a panic till you remember this is the first compartment of the stomach. If you can wait long enough you can escape once you hit the second compartment. The cow will regurgitate the grass mixed with saliva back into her mouth as cud. You can try to escape then. It’s only if you fail or get chewed up then that you will be doomed once sent to the 3 and the 4 compartments. You decided to save your strength and relaxed. Soo you drift of to sleep and only wake up as you fall into a lake of saliva and grass in the second stomach.
11133111121212222.title: You get swallowed

1113311112122.content:
Mid jump, the horses lips drop below you and snap shut. They push you and the rest of its bite onto its waiting tongue. The horse begins to chew, and you are helplessly thrown around like a rag doll. Left and right and back to center, you are rolled around in the horses maw, becoming part of a sticky pile of foliage. Hot Slime coats you, preventing your body from being crunched by the alfalfa stalks. You manage to break the surface of the saliva glob just in time to see a pink wave rush toward you. The entire contents of the horses mouth are forced backward, and you scream as you fight to no avail to escape the spit keeping you there. The last traces of the light are winked out as you sink down into the horses gullet.

You are pulled down the horses long esophagus, still fighting to free yourself because it's all you have now. The walls squeeze the mass of alfalfa and keep it shifting a bit. After a minute or so, it falls and breaks apart inside a pitch black chamber: the stomach.

You're crying now. You were lucky enough not to fall directly onto the acids no doubt collecting around you, but that will change.

A deafening rumble shakes the whole stomach and it shudders violently. You feel three powerful tremors, then nothing but a slight burn at your feet. Outside, the horse is turning its body slightly so it can see Zimmerman taking the other horses out into the pasture. It takes three steps and stops moving.

Your death comes not from the acid, but from the next mouthful the horse swallows. it lands right on top of you, crushing you quickly and painlessly. No one will ever know what happened to you.
1113311112122.title: Too slow...

choices: you start to swim to the edge
11133111122.content: The horse shakes its head, which creates a turbulent force of wind that pulls you closer and closer to its nostrils. You can't anything other than watch as the massive holes get closer and closer, before the horse gives off a deafening snort. A glob of snot twice your size adheres to you, and you are catapulted across the stall. With the goo in your eyes, you can't see but do feel and hear a splash, then feel the booger dissolve around you. You swim upwards to find yourself in a water trough. The mile-tall metal container is nearly three quarters full of water. Thankfully, because of your absolutely minuscule size it takes very little effort to stay afloat. You don't even break the surface tension. You'll need to figure out how to escape from here, and hopefully before the horse needs to grab a drink.
11133111122.title: Water trough

choices: Suddenly, the hose is pulled away from the trough!
The horse's head emerges above you!
You rest and climb up the hose.
111331111221.content:
Wasting no time at all getting yourself to safety, you start to swim toward the edge of the water trough, which is far harder than it sounds. The surface tension absorbs a lot of your motion, so it's more like wading through mud than anything else. Still, watching that metal wall grow ever closer is entirely satisfying.

It takes far longer than you are okay with, but you finally reach the edge, and brace yourself for the climb up and out. Unfortunately, the walls are quite smooth, even from your tiny perspective. Minuscule scratches and dings are too far apart for you to use, and the only other useable handholds require more finger strength than you currently possess. All you can do right now is hold on and catch a much needed breather.

Then you spy a green hose the size of a train tunnel hanging over the trough ledge a ways off. You know for sure you can get up that if you tried. With small movements, and a lot of floating along, you head toward it.

It is far easier to reach, and you confidently, albeit weakly, grip a groove in the green plastic. You finally catch a break today, or so you think...
111331111221.title: you start to swim to the edge

choices: You get sucked into the horse's mouth!
The horse takes a breath and sucks you into its nose!
111331111222.content: The sun is blotting out by a monstrous brown muzzle, which continues to descend toward the water's surface. Fortunately for you, the horse's mouth ends up half a mile away from you; unfortunately, it creates a current that is drawing you closer and closer to its maw! You swim as hard as you can, but there's no use. there is a strong current pulling you toward the horse's thirsty maw. little panicked whimpers escape you as you draw ever closer to the beast's head, and it rises higher and higher above you.
111331111222.title: a shadow appears overhead

choices: Someone comes and pets the horse
1113311112222.content:
You eventually give up trying to fight the current, you'll just die exhausted. As you approach the maw, you pass under the void that is the horse's left nostril. At that exact moment, the horse stops drinking to take a quick breath. Air washes over you, and you fly off the water's surface and towards the nose. You get lucky and grab onto a snot-covered hair, before you get sucked down to the horse's lungs. A moment later, the horse finishes drinking and returns to its stall door.

You carefully slide down the slick hair, and land in a puddle of goo. Trudging through the thick snot, you manage to reach the edge of the nostril. At that moment...
1113311112222.title: The horse takes a breath and sucks you into its...

choices: You see an animal's head emerge above you! You're in the pasture !
You start to head toward Zimmerman's home
11133111122221.content:
You gaze out into the world of the stable and think about your next move. It's hard to do; the view from this perspective is incredible! You can see every little thing in the air that you'd normally take for granted. Including...

Oh no...

Including the hair gently floating toward you! If the horse inhales that, you'll be blown to who knows where! You frantically struggle back through the snot puddle toward the closest nose hair. With any luck you can outlast the gale, but that's probably just wishful thinking. You quickly realize that there is no way you'll make it, and stare at the hair as it drifts inside the nostril cavern above you. The horse inhales, oblivious to you and the hair, and sucks it a little deeper inside. You see it catch two nose hairs simultaneously an-

Your flying! You shoot out, partially encapsulated in watery mucus, out of the horses nose, and out of the stable entirely. It must have turned its head at the last second. You careen toward the grassy ground at a slight angle. At last, you slam into a skyscraper sized blade of green, which would have killed you, had the snot droplet not just grazed it and broken into pieces. You are part of a smaller bit, and your velocity dramatically slows, now to a more survivable speed. You crash into another blade of grass and slide down with the rest of the snot. It's absorbed almost immediately after touching the ground, leaving you "safely" on the ground. What happens next?
11133111122221.title: The horse sneezes

choices: Have fallen into a hole in the ground
You have bumped into the paw of Zimmermans collie!
111331111222211.content: You sit down to take a break when a shadow falls over you. At first you think it is just a cloud but then you realize it has teeth and they are getting closer. You get up and Sprint full speed as far as you can. You turn around to see if it's closer. That was a mistake because you
111331111222211.title: The living cloud

choices: She noticed you on her hand!
She's moving to the next horse!
11133111122222.content:
Finally, the full view of the stable is clear. The ground looms just below you, and you wrap an arm around a hair for peace of mind. The horse breathes gently through its nose, but your mucus coating keeps you down and relatively safe.

"Well... What now?" You ask yourself out loud. Trying to climb the nose would be suicide , assuming you even got that far. The only thing keeping you safely in the nostril is the snot, which you are praising with each breath the equine colossus takes. You could climb down, maybe? You'd be betting on the beast NOT licking its lips, and the only path from there is to jump off when it lowers it ahead to eat. Either way, your options aren't promising.

Suddenly, your view is forcefully turned left as the horse faces a girly squeal in the distance. You hug the hair next to you and look out to see the source of the squealing: a girl, no older than ten years old, approaching, with Zimmerman not far behind her. She skips inside the stable and waits for Zimmerman to catch up. The horse follows her progress and stares down at her, tilting you dangerously toward the floor.

"HEY, BOY!!" She booms at you, or the horse, rather. She takes a step closer, making the horse tilt you even further. The mucus is starting to drip down and out of the nostril, spelling trouble for you.

"HOW'VE YOU BEEN?"

You see her great hand lifting up toward you, quickly blocking out the light. You panic and try to move back, without any luck. Her palm blocks the nostril and rubs past it slowly, hitting a bit of snot and taking you with it. Her hand rubs past one nostril and over the other, rolling you into a cocoon of booger on her palm.

Just as quickly as it started, it ends. The girl's hand falls back to her side and stops, with you caught near her index finger. You stay totally still, not wanting to fall to your death. You hear the girl and Zimmerman talking, but the mucus in your ears muffles it into gibberish. All of a sudden, the hand starts moving again!
11133111122222.title: Someone comes and pets the horse

choices: Stuck to her foot when she put her boot back on
111331111222223.content:
Your entire world was shaking as the little girl follows Mr. Zimmerman outside of the barn, but luckily you are able to remain stuck to her finger even though she was swaying her arms. Suddenly everything stops moving and once again you hear nothing but muffled talking as the little girl was saying something to Mr. Zimmerman. Once the talking stops you feel everything shaking again as you figure the girl must be walking again. What you don't realize though is the little girl is walking towards a nearby stool to take care of an itch on her foot.

As the girl was done petting the horse Mr. Zimmerman started to lead her outside of the barn and back to her mother who was waiting by her car. Once they were outside the little girl feels an itch on her foot and she asks, "Mr. Zimmerman, I have an itch on my foot, can we stop so I can scratch it?". Mr. Zimmerman replies,;"Sure darling, you can use the stool by the door". The girl than says "Thank you", and walks over to the stool. Once she sits down she removes her barefoot from her boot and she begins scratching her sole with her index finger (the same one the booger you are stuck in is on). After she finally takes care of the itch on her foot she puts her boot back on and continues to walk with Mr. Zimmerman back to her awaiting mother.

Meanwhile where was booger covered microscopic you when the little girl was done scratching her bare sole?
111331111222223.title: They're walking back outside

choices: Bailey takes off her boots, and changes into her sneakers.
Bailey wears the boots all the way home.
1113311112222232.content:
You don't so much hear the girl ask to scratch her foot as feel it rumble through you like thunder, distorted and deep, like you're listening to a thunderstorm rolling over the prairie, not a skinny blonde tween. The world zips by at jet-fighter speeds as the girl's hands dip down, and pull her riding boot loose. You're on the tip of her index finger, about half an inch below her fingernail -- or, at your scale, about 200 feet from it. Her nails aren't overly long, but still, you can see it looming over the horizon, a bit of chipped blue fingernail polish atop a 90-foot-high wall of nail.

The finger drops.

The sound it makes as it first passes over the itch is grating, grinding, like a wall of granite drug along a city street. You scream, as the nail abruptly reverses, and then back and forth a couple more times. You think...maybe you'll be...maybe you'll be okay....

On the very last pass, the young girl absent-mindedly rubs the spot of the itch, the dermal ridges of her finger sliding over it. You are lucky -- you had slid between a couple of them. had you been atop one, you probably would have been ground to paste, but instead, the motion causes the hard mucus around you to snap and crack. And then suddenly, the finger lifts away, and you begin to roll down her foot, which she's pointed toe-down into the boot.

You don't know what possesses you to reach out, but somehow you grab a hold of what appears to be a thick white cable. You will realize, after a while, that it was a very fine hair, one that would be barely-visible to someone looking very, very close. But then, you are, too.

The foot completes its movement, and you hear a grating, groaning sound as the zipper on the side of the boot is zipped.

And without a care for your safety, Bailey -- the girl -- puts her foot back on the ground, and begins to follow after that nice Mr. Zimmerman.

"She's getting to be a great rider," Zimmerman tells the girl's mother. "You feel free to bring her around next week if you want."

"I'll be sure to do that," the woman said. "She loves visiting this farm. Are you sure you don't want me to pay...."

"Nah, your dad gave me a good price on his land when he retired, and we don't want you to forget what the country's like, now, do we, Liz?"

"We only live twenty minutes away!"

"Even so," Zimmerman replied, with a grin. "And tell your husband that I might need some new equipment when he gets a chance."

"I will, Zim. Take care."

Bailey buckles herself in to the back seat, and Liz drives her car out onto the gravel road. Neither knows that there's a third passenger in the car.
1113311112222232.title: Booted

1113311122.content: You've been sailing in the air for a good while now. Every time you think you'll finally land, a gust of wind or the movement of immeasurable creatures sends you skyward yet again. You've flown through the barn, out over fields and pens, back through the barn, and over again. Fortune finally smiles on you, and you finally fall in front of the barn. That fortune quickly fades as the tell-tale earthquakes of an approaching beast reach your ears. Something's exiting the barn, it's a...
1113311122.title: Paws (dog, cat, other)

choices: The insides of the dog's nostril
11133111221.content: The head of a border collie nudges open the barn door, revealing the rest of its body. Standing at roughly two miles tall, while not the largest animal you've seen today it's still impressively massive. It exits the barn and, swinging its nose downwards, begins to sniff the dirt. You should be fine for now, as the dog is still a good few miles away: then again, that's only a few feet. Could the dog pick up your scent? You don't need to think for too long, as the colossal canine lumbers towards you, nose still sniffing about. With each step, the earthquakes increase in intensity until it simply throws you 10 feet in the air. Eventually, you are staring at a paw the size of a skyscraper, and craning your neck even higher up to the monstrous muzzle. A pair of nasal cavities swing just a hundred feet above your head, and as the dog takes a sniff it creates a gale. Your microscopic frame is much too light, and you find yourself airborne. This flight is short-lived, as you quickly reach your destination of...
11133111221.title: Border Collie

111331112211.content: Your body flies towards one of the gargantuan nostrils. As darkness envelops you, you finally land with a splat. You have just enough light to see that you are partly embedded in a slimy mountain, with massive towers strewn about. You struggle against the tar-like snot, and find you're stuck pretty well. So this is your life: trapped in a booger in a dog's nose. The landscape outside constantly changes, from grass to dirt to many massive objects. Occasionally, a pink wave slides upward and encases the outside walls with a slimy sheen. Suddenly...
111331112211.title: The insides of the dog's nostril

choices: The dog's tongue slides upwards to lick its nose!
The dog swings its head around, sending you flying!
1113311122111.content: After a bit of a struggle, you free your arms, legs, and body from the sticky quagmire that is the snot block. Now liberated, you head towards the exit. It seems the dog has finally settled down for a while, as you find yourself easily traversing the landscape. After a few minutes, you reach the nostril. As soon as you step on the leathery, slick surface, you lose your footing and begin to slide. At that moment...
1113311122111.title: You manage to break free!

choices: You manage to catch a hair
111331112212.content: You hit a black mass, and instantly feel the wet, cold texture of the dog's nose. Could be worse, at least you didn't get sucked in! However, you're now stuck fast to the dog's nose, and are subject to its every movement. You grow sick from the constant changes in direction and elevation, but have no chance of getting free. After a couple minutes of searching, the border collie gives up and lays down next to the barn. You hear the sound of a massive, wet object move as the lips beneath you part and a pink monolith extends. The dog is panting, letting its hot, humid breath wash over you. As this continues, the moist glue keeping you in place starts to weaken, and you slowly slide down the nostril towards a massive bridge of pink muscle. You try to grasp for a surface to cling to, but will it stop you in time?
111331112212.title: The tip of the nose

choices: Inhaling (you're blown further into the mouth)
1113311122122.content:
Your hand reaches for a nearby hair, but it slips just out of reach. You scream in terror as you fall off the nose, and continue to fall for a few hundred feet before landing with a soft squish. Despite the constant movement, you manage to stand up and gain a horrifying sight: the dog's maw. Teeth big enough to crush office buildings surround the insides, and frame the tongue perfectly. You can see a few scraps of food stuck between the ivory towers, probably from its last meal. This is definitely not a good place to be, so you turn around and struggle towards the tip.

As you walk, you are confronted with many challenges. The tongue is extremely soft, which means each foot step is a trial in and of itself. In addition, the taste buds and microscopic film of saliva translate to a landscape of hills and sticky swamps, making the journey even more treacherous. If that wasn't enough, the whole muscle shifts back and forth, so you are constantly being rocked, making it quite easy to fall into those saliva swamps. You are thankful for some of the saliva, though, as it keeps you secured to the tongue despite the tornado-scale winds blowing above you.

After a stress-filled few minutes, you reach the end of the tongue. Before you lies the dirt floor: a welcome sight at this point. You gather one last bit of strength, and jump. Of course, at that you are caught up in the breath of the dog: was he inhaling or exhaling?
1113311122122.title: You fall onto the tongue.

11133111221221.content: For some reason, you've stopped moving forward, and instead fly back into the mouth. You watch as ivory towers zip past, before the air flow reverses and slams you into the pink floor once again. This time, you splash down in a massive lake of saliva. You struggle to reach the surface, and can only watch in horror as the mighty jaws close shut. You are now wet, stuck, and in a dark tunnel bigger than any cavern in the world. You hear a series of rumbles and get rocked about as the dog seems to have stood up. The rumbles intensify, until you are thrown about the mouth by each movement. A few times you manage to grab onto a massive tooth, but you just as quickly are tossed back onto the tongue. Sooner or later, you're bound to fly down the throat and into oblivion.
11133111221221.title: Inhaling (you're blown further into the mouth)

111331112212211.content: The border collie jumps over a fence. Meanwhile, you find yourself suspended in the air for a moment, before watching as the light ahead of you disappears.
