You land in a water slide of saliva, and get swept with the current. Eventually, the liquid starts to tickle, then burn as it sloughs off your skin, bones, and organs. Your screams of horror are frozen for a moment, before getting dissolved as well.
111331112212211.title: Sure enough, you are swallowed

choices: UAGH! You're back in the stable!
You are outside, in the yard beneath a tree
111331112212212.content:
There's barely enough light inside the collie's mouth for you to see, much less figure out how not to plummet down its throat, as if you had any control over that at all in the first place.

Finally the dog stops moving, or at least it stops throwing you around inside its maw, and you get a brief respite. Unfortunately, that respite leaves you dangling over its throat, holding on by a couple taste buds. You try to pull yourself up a bit further, but the saliva coating you makes gripping impossible. The dog still hasn't moved, and you get a sinking feeling that something bad is about to happen.

Suddenly, a powerful torrent of wind flows into the dogs mouth and down past you. Your pathetic and already strained grip is no match at all, and you are ripped off the back of the tongue and carried into the deep dark of the dog.

The air currents only pull you down for a few seconds however, then they reverse course, propelling you back up the dogs throat and between its cavernous jaws. As the dog sighs, you are shot into the air, though you remain relatively low to the ground. As your vision adjusts to the burst of light, you see that you are...
111331112212212.title: You somehow survive the ordeal

choices: Stay near the food and water
Head for the dog! You're feeling brave!
1113311122122123.content:
A sea of white squares fill your view as you plummet to one of them. Your tiny frame crashes down on the hard surface; while you're too small to gain too much speed, you do get bruised up pretty bad. Taking another look around, you finally realize where you are: a kitchen.

The white squares are ceramic tiles, each half a mile long and with a canyon in between. A monolithic metal object lays to your right, and you watch as the border collie leans over it and begins to make lapping sounds. Good thing you escaped that mouth. As the dog laps up water, a few massive droplets splash on the tiles. One of them lands squarely in front of you, breaking into a few somewhat manageable droplets. You decide to take a moment, wash off, take a few sips, and look around. That's when you hear a ear-piercing squeal, and see moving objects in the distance. It's hard to tell, but it looks like someone just sat down. That's probably Zimmerman! You can also see a few things on the ground: crumbs and dust far larger than you, as well as a few black objects move across the tiles. Those must be insects, and hopefully you never have to confirm that.

You stop and think. Zimmerman is the only person who can help you right now, but to get to him you'll have to brave a wilderness who knows how many miles long, filled with all kinds of hazards. Zimmerman, his dog, even ants could accidentally step on you and end your life in an instant. Also, he's probably not going to stay there long, so you'd have to travel for Hours before you'd get the chance to try to contact him. On the other hand, you could stay near the dog's food and water bowl. It'll suck, but that's better than life outside. Of course, if you were REALLY stupid you could try to climb back onto the dog. Maybe it could bring you to a safer spot.

What to do, what to do.
1113311122122123.title: Inside Zimmerman's house!

choices: Mr. Zimmerman's niece who came to visit
11133111221221231.content: You decided it would be best to try to get Mr. Zimmerman to help you rather than stay near the dog. So you begin to walk towards the table to where Zimmerman was at and luckily he was having lunch so he won't be moving for a little while. After 30 minutes of walking you start to wonder if you will even make it to Zimmerman since your extremely tiny and you probably only have made it a quarter of a way to the table. While you were still walking you hear a deafening noise and you cover your ears in pain. After a couple of seconds the noise stops and you are able to hear again. But you then feel large tremors start shaking the ground and at the same time you could hear what sound like thunderous footsteps. As the quakes were getting closer you were able to see in the distance a unfathomably large pare of bare feet heading your way. Even though it won't help, you begin to sprint the opposite direction of the feet. But you are much to slow at your microscopic size and soon a shadow forms around you caused by one of the feet. You look up to see the sweaty foot about to come down on you and all you can do now is hope that you won't be crushed. Then the giant foot lands on you and the air moved from the foot blows you away. You don't get far because the surface of the sweaty foot makes you stick to it. Even though you couldn't move or see you were thankful that you were not dead. Suddenly you feel everything moving and you are blinded as light floods your vision. When you could see again you see you are moving away from the floor, which could only mean that you are now stuck on the sweaty sole of this giant's foot. What you don't realize is that you are stuck to the foot of...
11133111221221231.title: Start walking towards Zimmerman

choices: The next day, Zimmerman decides to clean the kitchen.
You get sloppy with your timing.
11133111221221232.content:
Life has been trying, but you're surviving. It's a routine, and you have to stick to it every day.

Like clockwork, Zimmerman comes at 7:12 in the morning and fills up Laika's bowl. Yeah, you found out the collie's name. Anyway, Laika takes to her breakfast rather quickly, so you are already on the base of the dog food bowl. You wait until Laika finishes and leaves, then you move in. You climb the bowl and take some food from the scraps left behind. It's only a few crumbs, but they're the size of houses. You stomach the dog-spit-enriched kibble, then climb back down. After Laika comes and goes for a drink, you make the climb into her water dish to rinse off and grab a drink yourself. You climb back out, and scoot back into the corner under the cabinet to wait for dinner, where you'd rinse and repeat. It's not much of a life, but at least you're alive.

There have been a couple incidents. A couple times, Laika got too energetic and pushed her food bowl, sending you flying across a kitchen tile. There was one breakfast that Zimmerman gave her wet food instead of kibble; you got stuck and almost didn't get out before dinner came around. And one time a curious ant started walking towards you, before a pair of sinkhole-sized nostrils sniffed the insect, and a wall of pink muscle slurped it up.

Yep, there's been a few problems, but so far you've handled everything thrown at you
11133111221221232.title: Stay near the food and water

111331112212212321.content:
This morning was different. Zimmerman fed Laika, but this time he didn't leave the house. Instead, he left for a while, then returned. It sounded like he had brought some objects with them, and he was placing them on the table. Your vision focuses, and you can read a few labels: "Windex", "Swiffer", "Bleach".

Uh oh.

This is going to be a really bad day. Your thoughts are confirmed as something moves towards your location. It's...
111331112212212321.title: The next day, Zimmerman decides to clean the ki...

choices: Too late, you get swept up !
You manage to avoid the broom
1113311122122123211.content:
((Hope you like the chapter. English is not my first language! Please understand and thanks author!))
As Zimmerman sighs while setting the items he bought onto the table, another figure follows him through the front door. You turn your focus on the person that followed Zimmerman: a young teenage girl. You hear her ask Zimmerman a question, addressing him as "Uncle". Zimmerman responds ending the sentence with the name "Olivia".

Olivia is 13 years old with red hair, freckles, and deep green eyes. She is wearing a red one direction band t-shirt, white khaki shorts and converse sneakers with apparently no socks. Unbeknownst to you, Olivia stays over with her uncle every weekend while her mother works out of town.

"Well Olivia, before you can get to ride the quad, you must do your chores here. Remember what we talked about. You can start by sweeping up these floors. Laika tracked in a lot of dirt and mud again after doing her business outside." Zimmerman tells his niece.

"Ok! Uncle are you also going to make breakfast? I am super hungry and mommy didn't make me any breakfast before dropping me off here!" Olivia asked as she grabbed the broom, Zimmerman smiles and looks down,

"I made breakfast an hour before your mom dropped you off here Olivia, I get up very very early sweetie but, you can fix yourself a bowl of cereal when you are done sweeping. I am going out back to feed the chickens and hopefully, get that piece of junk tractor started. I think I need to file the points, prime the carburetor, feed the pump and adjust the-" Zimmerman is then cut off by Olivia,

"Ok Uncle, you are losing me now." Olivia says, both Zimmerman and Olivia laugh before Zimmerman exits through the back door.

Now that leaves you, small and helpless on the ground as ever. Olivia observes the floors and nods, she then walks over to the closet to grab the dust pan. The mighty Converse sneaker crashes down just several feet from where you stand, knocking you off your footing in an instant! This is a nightmare come true and it is only going to get worse. Olivia then begins to sweep the floors, you brace yourself as the oncoming broom nears you! Olivia is completely unaware, listening to music on her phone with earphones. As the tree-sized bristles near, you know you must act quickly...
1113311122122123211.title: Zimmerman's Niece

11133111221221232112.content:
Using your pathetic excuse of fast reflexes, you manage to dodge the oncoming brooms giant bristles and do not get collected into the dust pan. Olivia dumps the contents into the recycling bin then sets the broom and dust pan back into their respective places in the storage closet. You sigh in relief; you had nearly wet yourself knowing that you could have been swept up like a piece of debri and discarded alive into the trash bin!

"I hope Uncle is happy. Now, Lets see what we got here." Olivia walks over to the pantry. She spots a box of frosted cornflakes and grabs it, heading over to the cupboards to get a bowl.

Meanwhile, you take cover behind a nearby chair leg. No way are you going to want to be standing on opens ground should another broom sweep across, or in the path of the giant teenage girls stomping feet. You wonder what Zimmerman is up to right about now. Is he really feeding the chickens and working on the tractor like he said? Speaking of tractor, what tractor in the first place? As far as you know, Zimmerman didnt even personally own a tractor and usually rented the equipment. Your thoughts are then interrupted by a loud CRASH just a few feet from where you stand!!

"AHHHH!!" You cry out in terror and stumble back! A huge, pink, flat squared object at least the size of multiple football fields crashes down before you hard, nearly knocking you off your feet! Its Olivia's cellphone. It got disconnected from the headphone plug and fell out of her hand as she fixed herself up breakfast. You really want to get off the ground and now could be your chance. Olivia's phone is wrapped in a case that is perforated which means you can safely grab a hold of it.

"Whoops...." Olivia said and began reaching for the phone. Now is your chance. You want to get to higher grounds so you do not waste another second. You stick your arms into the holes of Olivia's phone case and hang on for dear almighty as the phone is lifted off the floor. Your mind kind of goes blank here as everything happens so fast, your stomach flops and all you do is clench your eyes shut and grit your teeth tightly. Unfortunately, you can not keep your grip any longer and begin falling back down towards the floor. So much for getting the attention you desperately needed. As you helplessly free fall, you expect to simply land back on the tile floors below and find another way up. However, fate has other plans for you when you end up landing.....
11133111221221232112.title: Olivia prepares herself breakfast

choices: Venture inside, and try to hide.
Before you can decide, Olivia gets up.
111331112212212321121.content:
The phone lifts hundreds of feet into the air before you lose your grip. Unfortunately that's only like, three or four inches in the real world. But of course, the phone is already rocketing away from you, but the momentum of your brief travel has you following a trajectory that intersects right with an insanely large red wall.

You bounce off of it and flip end-over-end, coming to rest just as the up-elevator motion of her first step pulls you skyward. You are pinned to the canvas for but a moment, before the shoe drops out from beneath you. You bounce of the shin of the girl and ricochet forward, landing among the laces. Dazed, you somehow hang on through one more step -- the second of two -- that carry Olivia to the table and her breakfast.

You are one big bruise, and you really want to just fall to the floor and try to find your way back to the dog dish. It's a disgusting, pointless existence, but at least you'd be alive. Alas, even though you are just atop the shoe of a teenage girl, there's no way you could jump and be assured of not dying, at least not on tile.

You finally start to feel vaguely human again, enough to sense the constant slight earthquake of the girl's feet beneath you, to smell the funky foot odor that's become part of the shoe through many wearings. You can't stay here, you know. The girl is just eating her breakfast, and then she'll go somewhere else, and another set of footsteps like those and you might not survive. For a second, you think about trying to climb up her leg, but it's almost half a mile of sheer skin up to her knee alone. And while it's relatively still right now, it won't be for long. No, you'll have to find a way down, preferably before she goes outside.

Of course, if she goes outside, maybe she'll walk through carpet. That might work, you think -- the drop would be less. Maybe you could leap to safety and try to reformulate your plan.

Then again -- you're holding on to the laces above the shoe's tongue. They keep the shoe fastened, but not perfectly. The gap between the tongue of the shoe and the shoe itself isn't much to the giantess above you, but to you it's a good ten-foot difference. Maybe if you got inside the shoe, you could find someplace relatively secure, and wait for the girl to settle down for the day. It's risky, but while you're not sure you'll ever be able to get anyone's attention, you actually are closer to a person than you've been in weeks; part of you would rather die trying to get found than live off a dog's crumbs.

You don't have long to decide. If you want to jump off to the carpet, you need to get closer to the toe of the shoe. If you want to go into the shoe and find a hiding place, well, it's time to do so. What do you do?
111331112212212321121.title: A Really Big Shoe

choices: Olivia takes her shoes off while out in the barn.
Olivia keeps her shoes on, and several hours later....
Olivia eventually becomes still enough for you to climb back to her foot.
1113311122122123211212.content:
You've been living on scraps from a dog for weeks. You can't do this anymore. If it's the end of daylight savings, that means it's fall already. You can't keep living like this! Even if you're probably going to die, you have at least the faintest hope of human contact; you aren't going to pass on the opportunity.

You scurry across the tongue of the shoe, and throw yourself into the abyss, and none too soon. Just moments later, Olivia's foot shifts, and you bang against the clammy skin, sliding off the side. You try to grab on to something to slow yourself, but she lifts her foot just enough to bring the sole of the shoe to you. You tumble down into a crevasse just outside the sole insert and the shoe itself, and then the foot lands with a earth-rattling bang, before it lifts again, and hits again, and lifts again.

You curl up in a ball, along with lint and dust and debris and skin cells, whimpering as Olivia simply walks out of the kitchen to help her uncle. All you can do is stay here, and hope you somehow survive.
1113311122122123211212.title: Shoe. In.

choices: You are spilled off the spoon!
111331112212212321122.content:
What you did not see, or expect, until it was too late, was the sudden, bone freezing chill of a bowl of milk the size of a Great Lake. You do not splash, per se, considering you have about as much weight as a dust particle, but you settle onto the surface and dent it... it's hard to explain. Regardless, you are in a bowl of cereal, surrounded by crunchy mountains with holes big enough for you to fit in.

The cold immediately began to work on your brain and motor skills. You pull yourself along the surface, hearing the distant click click click of Olivia's texting high above you. You "swim" to the nearest mass of cereal and climb up the side of it, shivering violently. At the top, you see the vast expanse of... cheerios? Aww! You like cheerios! If you survive this, you'll never eat them again. Giant atolls are packed into a space surrounded by a floral painted wall that you have no hope of reaching.

No sooner had you stopped climbing, you hear another crash and feel a flight tremor. You look up and see Olivia putting her phone down and staring into the bowl.

Suddenly, like an alien spaceship, a huge silver oval hovers over you and descends! "Olivia!" You scream. "No! I'm down here!" You wave your arms frantically, hoping beyond hope that she spots you, which she can't. The spoon dips below the milks surface and you feel the contents of the bowl pulling toward it, you drop to your knees and hang on for dear life. High above you, Olivia is smiling. Why she could be happy when you are in so much danger is a mystery.

The spoon lifts away, splashing a bit of milk back down around you. You narrowly avoid a drop the size of a mansion and end up diving right off the bit of cereal, back into the milky depths. It is a little warmer, but still too cold to be comfortable, and you swim around to try and find high ground once again.

With a flash of silver, you are lifted dizzyingly fast out of the bowl. Olivia's body descends below you, finally stopping at her cavernous, gaping maw. "Olivia, please!" You scream. How can she hear the pleas of dust, I ask you? The girl brings the spoon toward her mouth and... and...
111331112212212321122.title: "SPLASH" Into Olivia's cereal.

1113311122122123211222.content:
Olivia never heard you. The combination of her cellphones speaker and lack of attention she paid made you nothing more than a mere addition to her breakfast!

"AAHHHH!!!-" Your screams were cut short as Olivia wrapped her lips around the spoon, taking in the contents of her spoon and began to chew. Olivia smiled as she texted her friends on her cellphone, chewing her mouthful of cereal and eventually swallowing....

30 minutes later that day, Zimmerman puts his niece to work at the farm. Olivia throws on some work boots and begins to feed the chickens, cows, pigs etc. You simply fueled a beautiful teenage girl til lunch.
1113311122122123211222.title: Devoured

choices: Out into the yard;  it's all dust anyways.
1113311122122123213.content:
Far off in the distance, a great roaring noise erupts. It continues for some time, slowly growing in volume. Eventually, you notice that Zimmerman is approaching, with the sound coming from him and a black object. As the hose moves closer, you realize you're about to get sucked up by a vacuum! There's no escape, no hand hold that could free you from the maw of this mechanical beast. You lift into the air and fly backward into pitch darkness and a deafening, mechanical whining sound. Grains of sand the size of cars and hairs the lengths of trains sail around you, some even colliding with you as get thrown down the dark tube. At the end of it, you are deposited in a maelstrom of flying debris, spinning around and around in a large chamber of dust.

After a few minutes of utter chaos and darkness, the whirring of the vacuum stops and you begin to settle amidst the hot dusty ground inside the cavernous chamber. More settles on top of you, keeping you from moving, as if you could have actually escaped. You feel the vacuum being lifted and carried somewhere, and begin to see a little light around you.

Zimmerman finishes vacuuming, and carries the now full vacuum cleaner outside to dump out all the dirt. Where does he dump it?
1113311122122123213.title: A vacuum cleaner

choices: You reach the edge and climb for your life!
111331112212212322.content:
You wake up with a yawn, and look at the time. 7:15. Huh, guess you overslept, and missed Laika's chow session. Oh well, you get up and walk over to the food bowl. 45 minutes later you reach the top and slide down. You head towards a nearby crumb, and start eating. As the clock reads 8:12 you hear a rumbling sound, and watch as Zimmerman enters the kitchen. Wait, he's usually out of the house by now. You stare in confusion as Zimmerman walks over to the clock on the wall, and turns the hour hand back by one, muttering something about "Daylight Savings".

Crap. It was 6:15 when you woke up, not 7:15! That means he hasn't fed Laika yet!

You suspicions are confirmed as Laika runs into the kitchen and starts to dance around Zimmerman. He laughs, and walks over to the cabinet. Crap, today's wet food day! He opens the can, walks over, and picks up the food bowl. You are knocked off your feet as you experience a roller coaster of g-forces. Zimmerman rests the dish on the counter, and you watch as a massive tin can and spoon hover overhead. With a scraping sound, the spoon shoves out lake-sized portions of the gravy and bits. You run as hard as you can, but with every spoonful the food tsunami inches closer to you.
111331112212212322.title: A "small" mistake

Zimmerman, who's going to clean the bowl!

Zimmerman finishes scooping out the meal, and carries the bowl back to Laika's feeding area. The monstrous hand is quickly replaced by the maw of a hungry border collie. You curl up in the fetal position and pray for your life as the dog's massive tongue sweeps up whole portions of the ocean below you, before chewing and swallowing the building-sized pieces.

The ordeal is over as soon as it started. Regaining your composure, you return to the site of the feast to collect your breakfast. Your plans get interrupted a second time today, as a massive shadow streaks overhead. It's...

A pair of giant mandibles open up and go to grab you...
11133111221221232211.title: When the ants come marching

111331112212212322111.content:
The ant rushes you and grabbed you in its mandibles. Your lifted off your feet as the ant joins the parade of ants holding crumbs as they return to the nest. You hit and scream trying to get free but it’s no use. The ant crawled into its mound and you temporarily forget what’s happening. Your in awe of the way the constructed the tunnels and the way some seem to have a pattern design to them. You only pulled from your musings when the ant released you to fall into a hole with the crumbs and other thing. Looking around they must have dropped you into the food storage. Getting up you try and find a way out only to notice that the walls are too steep to climb. You lean against the wall and drift off to sleep.

You awaken some time later as your jostled around by an ant carrying you out of the storage area. It took many twists and turns till it came to a large chamber with an even larger ant in it. The ant holding you came forward and dropped you among a few crumbs. Looking up you scream in horror as you recognize the bigger ant as a queen and she is steadily chomping on crumbs and another insect about your size.

Your scream seemed to catch her attention as her head moved towards you. The antenna on her head waved around your body. Once removed the Queen....
111331112212212322111.title: The ant takes you back to its nest

choices: something big coming from the outside
1113311122122123221113.content:
Turns it's attention back towards the food and begin's eating. Realizing just how lucky you just got. You get yourself up and begin to bolt out of the nest. Once you start running down a couple of random tunnels. You stop to take a breath, while doing so you look around. Upon seeing nothing but dirt and tunnels, you begin to think about how hopeless your situation is. But then you scratch off any thought of giving up. Your drive to survive and one day grow back to normal is to big for you to just to sit here and hope to die. Upon thinking that last thought you felt a quake.

Quickly getting up, you braced yourself as the quakes felt more and more powerful. Looking up you see an ant charging in your direction. Having the thought of this being your only chance to get somewhere fast. You jump forward as the ant is passing by your direction. Clinging onto one of its legs, your swayed back and forth as the unaware ant is charging towards its destination. Hoping to yourself that this ant is taking you to the way out.

You can't see much of anything at this point with trying to do your best with holding onto the ant's leg. With the ant moving so fast and swaying you around so much. The task was a bit harder then you originally imagined it might have been. But even with this you were still able to somehow keep your grip. Hearing other ants past by and seeing nothing but the hairy ants leg. This had truly made you feel tiny.

Of course though you got to a point where you just could not hold on anymore and with one quick slam of the ant's foot you were tossed to the side of the tunnel that it was in. Dirt came up against you like a fluffy cloud and you were instantly covered in it. Hitting the wall hurt at that speed and it hurt even more to have to watch your ride out of here leave. You just laid yourself up against the wall. You felt fortunate that you didn't feel anything broken, just a bit bruised up. Feeling tired, your body was forcing you to sleep. You were trying your best to stay awake and get up to grab another passing ant but your body was at it's limit. Then while looking around one last time before you gave in to sleep. You see light shining into the tunnel which was about a mile down the tunnel that you were in. You then just knocked out against the wall.

A day had passed and you just slept in that one spot. Luckily for you that you just blended in so well with the dirt or you might have been put into a similar situation like you started in. You began to finally wake up, for a moment you had forgotten the situation that you were in. But upon seeing the light that was a bout a mile away from you. Your memory was instantly jogged. Feeling a bit better you stand up. You were a little sore but felt better due to the rest that you just got. With wasting no time thought you made your way in the direction of what you can now tell is sunlight.

Thinking to yourself the whole walk that you can finally leave this ant hill and make it to your next terrible giant location. But you didn't care what came next, the only thing that matter to you was getting out of this place. Then with being about a foot away, you saw specs of dirt start falling from the top of the exit, which was followed by quakes....

(What was causing this?)
1113311122122123221113.title: Ignored you. You try and escape

111331112212212322112.content:
"Oh great, looks like we've got ants again."

You hear the godlike voice of Zimmerman in the distance, and notice his massive frame up above you. He lets out a massive sigh, before opening up a nearby cabinet. Meanwhile, your tiny body was getting collected by one of the monster ants, and carried away. Zimmerman's face appears again, this time holding a massive metal tower. His finger depresses a button on the top, and a spray of chemicals blasts you and the ants. You feel a burning sensation as the spray invades every opening of your body, eating away at you. You die within seconds, as well as the ant army about your.

Zimmerman then picks up Laika's bowl, and rinses out the ant corpses and poison, as well as a minuscule human body.
111331112212212322112.title: Zimmerman notices the ants

choices: You land on some dirty dishes
11133111221221232212.content:
ZImmerman noticed that Laika's bowl could use a wash, and so he picked it up and rinsed it out in the sink.

A massive hand fills your view, and you fall on your back as the bowl is lifted heavenward. Another shadow approaches, this time a massive metal grate looms overhead. You smell the familiar scent of soap and rust. Another hand moves behind it, and the ear-piercing shriek of moving metal is joined by the rushing sound of an ocean of water.

You had no chance. The deluge blasted the bowl, along with you and any crumb inside. You helplessly swirl around the lake-sized bowl, before the water finally began to overflow. As you approached the edge, you prayed you could find some way out of this.
11133111221221232212.title: Zimmerman, who's going to clean the bowl!

choices: Yes! There's a leak in the drain pipe!
111331112212212322122.content:
Straight down the drain:

The sink is an empty basin of silvery metal, as you quickly find out. Zimmerman tilts the bowl, adding more water and acceleration to your plummet. You fall with a large stream of water over the bowl's edge, and fall right into the sink. More water keeps you moving in a massive vortex of draining water, which pulls you toward the gaping hole in the center of the sink. Around and around and around you go, drawing ever closer and faster to the drain. In a matter of seconds, you are sucked through a hole in the drain filter, and plunged into darkness.

Now, the real question is: do miracles exist?
111331112212212322122.title: Straight down the drain

1113311122122123222.content:
Eventually you are swept off your feet by the gelatinous liquid, and are washed onto a building-sized chunk of beef. You are overwhelmed by the stench of low-grade meat. Zimmerman finishes scooping out Laika's meal, and throws away the tin can. Picking up the food bowl, you are shifted around a sea of gravy and end up in the middle of the dish. Said dish finishes its descent back to the floor, where Laika is waiting patiently for her meal. As soon as his hand leaves the bowl, she makes her move. You watch in horror as an enormous tongue slides out and scoops you up in a second flat. As she chews, you are tossed off your beef chunk and fly about her mouth. Eventually you land with a splat in a drop of gravy on her tongue, and look back as you slide towards her throat. Soon enough, the entire mouthful shifts towards the back, and you are taken for the most horrifying log plume ride of your life.

As soon as you land in the stomach, the acid works its magic. It incinerates you in an instant, leaving no traces of your existence.

Laika finishes her meal and heads towards the sheep pen to work, unaware of what transpired that morning.

On moist dirt, watching the dog giant trot away
11133111221222.content: You feel a mighty wind push against your back, and you are thrown out of the dog's mouth. The fall is a short one, though no less terrifying and quite painful, and you end up...
11133111221222.title: Exhaling (you're blasted out)
