You fall off by a pond
11133111222.content:
Zimmermans German Shepard exits the barn and you stare at the monumental dog in terror. You watch, frozen in amazement and fear, as it approaches , slows down, and stops very, very, uncomfortably close to you. It sticks it's nose into the air and sniffs, filling the air with the sound of slow, deep breaths. Then it tilts it's head down to your general direction and starts to sniff around.You crane your neck to see the name on the dogs collar and read SPIKE.

"SPIKE!" you scream out of curiosity, as to if he'll hear you. Nothing happens but more sniffing. "SPIKE!" You try again, not really sure why. The giant dog tilts his head and starts to bring his muzzle towards you. This is when the feeling of danger hits you. Spike could breathe in and take your speck size body into his mouth or his nose. There's no way it would know or smell you at this size.

You then get an idea. If you can get on to Spikes paw, you can stay there until he goes into Zimmermans house, then you can get to Zimmerman who can hopefully get you back to normal size. Steering well clear of the monolithic nose dropping toward the ground, You sprint towards the closest paw and realize that it's as big as a football stadium. You jump on to the black padding, which now looks more like giant black scales, and start climbing. You climb until you're steady and then nestle yourself in a crook just beneath the toe's claw. It stinks of mud, but beggars can't be choosers. You suddenly feel a rumbling and a shift in the paws position. Then Spike starts to walk.
11133111222.title: Friend or foe

111331112221.content:
Spike’s paw slowly begins to ascend, or it seems like it does to you. Everything is slow, really, but that doesn’t make it any less terrifying or traumatic. The paw rises high into the air and briefly goes limp, nearly throwing you out of your hiding spot, then it comes careening back down to the ground, which also nearly knocks you out. Over and over this happens, so frequently that you can’t count the steps, or concentrate on where it is you are going. It takes every ounce of your strength and concentration just to stay where you are. The smell of dirt and animals are your only clue to your outdoor location.

What you do notice amidst the chaos, is a sudden change in light and temperature. Spike is also slowing down. You sneak a peek at the outside world and resist the urge to jump for joy: you made it inside! Then you start to panic all over again. Sure there aren’t any horses or cows or gusts of wind, but a house has its fair share of dangers, including your current transport dog. You manage to see a light grey carpet and ready yourself.

As Spike steps down, you leap from the paw onto a thick fiber and immediately scramble for whatever cover you can get to. It’s a short lived attempt, as the air current made by Spike’s wagging tail send you flying through the air once again. You watch from the air as Spike walks around a bed (apparently you’re in the bedroom now) and walks out, evidently searching for Zimmerman. He is gone by the time you settle onto the carpeted floor, which is now a sea of fibrous trees packed so closely together you can jump from to the other.

You see that Zimmerman hasn’t made up his bed yet, and a bit of the sheet is touching the floor. If you made it there and climbed up you could, in theory, somehow maybe get Zimmerman’s attention from the top of the sheets. Or, you could be a bit more adventurous and head into the living room, where tile floors would make things a bit easier, but lose any potential of shelter by wandering giants.
111331112221.title: You make it to Zimmermans house without incident

choices: you start heading back up the hill, away from the pond.
111331112222.content:
flying through the air without control was nothing at all compared to the motions of the German Shepard. from beneath its bus-sized claw, every motion threatens to throw you forward and off the dog completely. you are pressed against the brown fur with each rise of the paw, and cringe every time it descends, until you slam to the ground and watch the grass and dirt come dangerously close to you. not to mention the paw kicking off to actually move; you lose your footing every time Spike does it, saved only by the individual strand of fur that serves as your lifeline. its is all so chaotic that you cant even count the steps Spike takes.

Suddenly, just as quickly as it began, the dog stops in its tracks. shaking in an adrenaline high, you easily smell mud and water and decaying foliage. you can hear spike lapping up water also, so he's probably stopped at a pond, or a very large puddle. you cautiously let go of the hair and try to look out at your surroundings. BIG mistake...

spikes paw digs into the mud moments later, forcing your body into the soft mud below. you lie there, face down, feeling Spike's steps grow weaker as he leaves. when you can no longer feel them, you pry yourself out of the mud and look around:

the pond, which to you is a literal ocean, spanning as far as you can make out, rest at the bottom of a tiny hill, effectively blocking you from seeing anything behind you. the ground is gouged and mountainous, the result of continuous hooved animal traffic. thankfully, Spike left you only NEAR a massive hoof print, rather than inside one. you peer over its edge and grimace at the dizzying drop.
111331112222.title: You fall off by a pond

11133111222211.content: The ground shakes as a massive wall of green fills your view. The frog was massive, it looked like it could easily swallow an airliner. Speaking of which, a massive fly lazily flies past, only to get caught by the frog's massive tongue. The action was so fast, you didn't even have time to blink. Your face twists as you are forced to witness the frog feast on the insect. Before you can react, something large and slimy slams into you. What was it?
11133111222211.title: Frog

choices: Stay still (notices it's stepping on something snack or capture or unnoticed)
Try struggling free (it feels you moving snack or capture or it doesn't feel you
111331112222111.content:
The sounds the frog makes as it crunches on the fly are disgusting and creepy since if found it might be you next. Slowly creeping backwards as to not be noticed, the frog stills gulping down the fly. Taking that chance you try and run only for a shadow to cover you, turning back to look as something slams in to you chest. Landing on your back hard you look to see the frog had taken a step forward and was now pinning you to the ground with one of its rounded toe pads. It seems to be looking around, opening and closing its mouth, like it detects something but can't find it.

A human is near, senses the frog, but I can't see it. Opening and closing its mouth, to get a better smell, It takes a step forward being cautious since many have been taken to never return. If ever the chance came to get revenge on a human it would capture it and take it to the frog home to let the others decide it punishment. Enuf of the young ones have come so the frogs knew what humans smelled like.

The pressure of the foot pushes you into the muddy ground, not to much the really hinder your breathing just enuf to really hold you down,making you are to scared to move. You can't tell if you should stay still and wait to see what happens may be it will leave or risk detection to try and struggle free without notice. At your size it might not notice you, but you can't take the chance.
111331112222111.title: The frog's foot

choices: Stuck to the toe ( a juvenile frog sees you/ you where left on the ground Run!
You where crushed by the frogs leap.
1113311122221111.content:
Fear of being eaten keeps your body frozen while the frogs foot is holding you down. Just thinking about how easy it had eaten the fly really freaked you out. The frog must not have located what it was looking for and closed its mouth. Next thing you know the pressure increases on you as the frog takes leap back to the pond edge.

The humans scent is near but it can't bee seen. It's better to return to the safety of the pond and warn the others. Pressing down to leap of, one of the frogs toes be on a pebble, cause it feels solid. Landing back at the pond the frog it greeted by the small juveniles that recently emerged from tadpoles.
1113311122221111.title: Stay still (notices it's stepping on someth...

choices: On a sidewalk right outside the farm (broke free from the frog toe)
At a campsite a good distance away from the farm (broke free from the frogs toe)
still stuck in the frogs toes
1113311122221112.content:
The frog just keeps hoping in one direction. Since you were attached to it's back leg the frog was assuming with each hop forward that it was getting away from the human. The movement felt awful to you, with every step muddy water would fly up into your face causing you to drink it at most points. This was then followed by the next awful thing the speed at which the frog would jump, making you just feel sick. After like the 10th or so jump (you lost count), you knew that you had to try and break free. So in a great attempt to get free, you start struggling.

With each struggle you give, you just kept hoping that you could break free without the frog gaining any notice of you. Luckily or maybe more like unluckily for you that you were to small of speck for the frog to become aware of you. Being this small made your movements to the frog as nothing. So with one jump and muddy water flying back at you, makes your struggling useless and had actually helped you to become more stuck into the frog's toe.

Spitting out water and mud you stop struggling for a couple moments. With everything going on and the attempt to struggle free being a waste of time. You were ready to just give up on life in general, you thought as your body drifted off to sleep. The frog continues to just keep hoping away, stopping once and while to chomp down on some unfortunate bug, then getting back to jumping. Eventually though the muddy water had stopped flying into your face as the frog had got out of the moist grassy dirt environment and into a more hard dirt ground. At this point you begin to wake up, and come back to the reality of what your life still is. Your rest has given you new strength and with the frog stopping to take its rest. Getting free seemed like the best thing to try and do.

So taking a sec to get in a good position, you begin to try and struggle free. And after a good minute you seem to make a little bit of progress as your body is being pushed forward. You stop for a moment to catch your breath, you used a lot of strength to only get a few cm's. But thinking that time isn't really on your time with when the frog wakes up it will just try to jump again. So you get ready and begin your struggling once more to be presented with...
1113311122221112.title: Nothing but a speck of dirt

111331112222112.content: Once again, the action was blindingly quick. One second, you're outside next to a behemoth that could swallow a building. The next, you're inside a rank mouth, glued to a massive tongue. The saliva quickly lubricates you, and you slip down the gullet towards your doom.
111331112222112.title: The frog's tongue

11133112.content:
The horse must be taking a nap, as it is standing perfectly still. You don't question that too much, or else you might jinx it. You grab for the horse's leg hair, and continue climbing. You find the hairs a bit easier to climb, more like a series of ledges, and in addition your smaller size means your muscles are working less, so overall you can climb much faster and higher than a normal sized human. That's all rather useful for climbing a 6-mile tall pillar of flesh. Come to think of it, you could probably set the record for fastest vertical climb...well, you could if a foot wasn't over a mile to you. You continue climbing upwards, and notice the view. From the horse's knee, you can see pretty much everything from up here: the stall door, the horse's food and water trough...and a few brown, sticky mountains you'd rather not get associated with. Taking a quick moment to catch your breath, you move onwards and upwards.

So long as this horse doesn't move, you should be pretty safe. Of course, it's very unlikely that this will be the case, especially if his owner comes in. And that could happen any minute...
11133112.title: You've still got your luck, for now.

choices: Start up toward the head. It's a good vantage point
I wonder what's on its back? Nice easy walk.
111331122.content:
The horses knee gave you a little bit of a rest, but you quickly find out that you were only a third of the way or so to the animals back. Then you had the outward incline created by the horses muscular shoulders to deal with, and then the heat of the passing day. You ended up looping around and got stuck at the horses armpit and had to backtrack to get around it.

But, finally, after nearly two hours of off-and-on climbing, you make it to the horses hairy back. At least, you assume so. The ground is level, but it's individual hairs are full grown trees at your size. Your practically a skin mite to this beast. The ground is somewhat flaky with dead skin, creating a rough terrain for you. Not to mention the residual body heat the horse gives off.

Well, you're up here, for whatever reason, safe from something. You can either start exploring the endless forest of the horses back, or start your way up its neck toward its head, braving the hill of muscle and a long ridge of white hairs half as thick as you.
111331122.title: You're fine, keep climbing!

choices: His empty hand, come to pet the horse
1113311221.content:
You are already at the base of the horses neck, so you figure you might as well make the trip upward. Using the creatures brown hair as braces, you begin your ascent.

As you reach the first of the white mane hairs draped over the horses neck, you begin to ponder a few things. First and foremost: how the heck are you going to get back to normal?! Those two guys took off with the shrink ray, or whatever it was, and you may have spooked them enough not to come back. Second: when was this horse going to wake up? The sun has been out for a few hours now and it hasn't moved a muscle. It's best not to dwell on that little detail.

The incline of the neck is like the ridge of a high mountain. It comes to a point where the mane hairs emerge and cascade down one side like a waterfall. Each one is about half as wide as you are, unlike the body hairs, so using them for stability is easier. They also provide a bit of shade as you head up. You keep to the edge of the mane, not going into it should you become stuck. The hairs are pretty densely packed.

Finally, after what could be a few minutes to an hour, probably the former, you see the mane hairs change direction, shifting parallel to you. You make out twin peaks rising up on either side of you: the horses ears. You've successfully climbed a horse the size of a city. Congratulations. You keep going until the mane hairs are no longer sprouting and wedge yourself between two of them to take a breather.

From here, through the last of the mane hairs, you can make out the entire stable, from its other inhabitants to the items hanging on the walls to-

"MORNIN BOYS!!" A deep voice booms. You feel the horse jolt slightly in momentary fright. You see Zimmerman enter the stable and start going about his duties, whistling a little tune, oblivious of anything to do with you being so nearby. You watch as he takes each of the bigger horses, the two shires and two clydesdales, out of the stable and disappear around the corner. Now the paint horse is awake and surveying its surroundings, buffeting you with screaming winds each time it turns its head. You hug a hair for dear life and watch Zimmerman return. He moves toward the center of the stable and appears to grab something, then he approaches the two of you. Looking closely, you see that Zimmermerman is bringing forward
1113311221.title: Start up toward the head. It's a good vanta...

11133112213.content:
Zimmerman's enormous hand rises up toward you, which is terrifying since he doesn't even know you are about to be crushed under his fingers. Speaking of those, they are rough enough to sand wood! This guy has been working for quite some time to have developed callous like that- enough! This isn't the time! You release your grip on the hair, prepared to jump rather than become a bloody speck on a horse's head.

Just before the hair makes contact, the horse bucks its head slightly, throwing you forward and sending you tumbling down its face. Tumbling may not be the best word; you are sailing just over the hairs. Within a few seconds, however, gravity takes over again, and you land squarely in a white patch of hair, painfully. One of the hairs slams into your midsection, knocking the wind out of you. You land on your back, still unable to take a breath, and lay there in shock. A few seconds and you're back and standing up. Just in time for a shadow to blot out the light above you. Zimmerman's massive palm is plummeting toward you! You scream with your puny voice and duck, waiting for the inevitable.

The ground definitely shudders, but you find yourself very not- crushed. You look up and see a small portion of the Palm just over you. So close in fact that you reach up and touch it, just to come to grips with how close it came. It seems that the hairs prevent the hand from coming down further.

Wait; this is perfect! You can get off the horse now! As quickly as you can, you move your way to a crease in Zimmerman's Palm. Just in time too. As his hand lifts up and away dizzyingly fast, you are held safe in the crook of his hand. It lifts up and falls back to Zimmerman's side as he walks out of the stable. Wind whistles past you as Zimmerman walks, and his hand sways gently back and forth, but you are more or less safe.

You peek out after a little bit and see that Zimmerman has passed his front door and is headed around to the back of the house. As he rounds the corner, you see a well tended garden looming in the distance. It looks overgrown at first glance, but the thick vines and impressively high stalks are all vegetable plants. Zimmerman stops before it and lifts his hands, stretching them out and catapulting you off and down into the plants. You land roughly
11133112213.title: A gardening trip

choices: You continue on and make it across
1113312.content:
At your current size, walking along a single stalk of straw is akin to walking atop a train that isn't even moving. When you come to the end of one, you simply jump to another one and continue on. You count five long stalks of walking before you make it to the stall door. Still, you have no idea where you are going besides "away," but anything has to be better than that horse, right?

Speaking of which... You hear a rustle behind you and the stalk you're standing on vibrates slightly. You turn back and see the titanic head of the equine beast half buried in the pile of straw. You thank your good decision making, but can't help but imagine yourself inside that mouthful the creature lifts away with. You turn around and put on a little burst of speed.

As you hop down onto the dirt, you finally see that your journey to wherever is going to be an arduous one: pieces of straw litter the ground all across what you can see of the floor, which isn't much. Where there isn't straw, you make out rolling hills, the product of regular traffic, which spells trouble for you. You can still easily make out the Clydesdale in the opposite stall, absently standing there, oblivious to you.

Thankfully, many of the straw stalks you come to can be walked under, but a few of them do require you to either walk around or climb over, both of which waste precious time. The hills and prints are no different. Regardless, after over an hour of traversing the rough terrain of a floor, you've managed to make it to the center of the stable walkway, and you stop and catch a breather, sitting on a grain of sand nearly as tall as you. You look around and see all that you can inside, and it kind of freaks you out. You're still having trouble contemplating just how small you are
1113312.title: Escape to the outside

11133122.content:
Suddenly you hear a noise. You look out and see the towering form of Zimmerman approaching over the hills and straw. It's clear already that he won't step on you, but you hide anyway, beneath a slightly bent stalk. He steps over you and the stalk protects you from the air current he creates in passing. Once he's gone, you step out and watch him walk to the end of the stable and face a horse you can't see. Its head pokes over the stall door and you see it's the same shire horse the two strangers were shrinking and regrowing. Zimmerman takes a set of straps off the wall nearby and puts it over the horses head. He holds the reins and opens the door. The shire walks out behind him and they both head directly toward you. Not good! You begin running toward the side of the stable, even though it contains an even bigger horse than the one behind you. It quickly becomes clear that you aren't going to make it, but you don't give up hope. Each step of the shire shakes the ground, until they're so strong they make you trip. You stand back up just in time to see the horses hoof lifting toward you. What would take less than a second to occur at regular size, the hoof lifting takes a full five seconds before it starts to descend onto you. No amount of running will save you now. You sink to your knees and close your eyes, ready to face death.

The world goes black as the hoof stomps down, shaking the ground and creating a shockwave that leaves your ears ringing painfully. Wincing, you open your eyes and see a light ahead. You look up and see the horses hoof dangerously close, but not crushing you. A thick metal barrier around the edge of the hoof separated you from a quick death: the horseshoe.

It lifts upward, blasting you with light and creating an air current that lifts you effortlessly into the air behind it you swirl and fly with the hoof, watching as it takes another slow, lumbering step. the impact from it blows you a little further up, closer to the shire's black underbelly. You look back and see its hind legs approaching. You pass between them a few seconds later, after you have started to descend again. This time, both legs create the strong wind, and you are launched upward as they pass. Up, up, up, between its tail and its thick legs
11133122.title: You hear something...

choices: Straight toward the maw of a yawning horse!
Toward a huge canvas bag on the ground
Out of the stable, into Zimmerman's yard
111331221.content:
You're flying upward with too much force to stop by yourself, and the air currents around you prevent you from actually being able to reach anything. As you approach the base of the horses tail, you can't help but look back at the its rear, partially, because that's just the way the air turned you. It's the size of a city, each hair is an apartment buildings and, well, you'd rather not be staring at the puckered ring of flesh as large as a city block.

With a casual flick of the horses black tail, you are careening out from behind it. the hairs move so slowly to you. The wind launches you along their length as they approach the horses flank and smack it, creating a shockwave that pushes you further away from its body. You fly up a bit and watch as the shire exits the stable and rounds the corner toward the pasture. You breathe a short sigh of relief, short being the big word here, because you are floating in a room with massive animals that have no idea you are there. A little on edge at that thought, you turn to see where the air current is taking you.
111331221.title: The horse passes by

choices: The stable. The horse is yawning again
A massive metal bridle bit passing over you!
An approaching pile of hay! The horse is about to eat!
1113312211.content:
As you turn yourself around, you feel yourself picking up some speed. It takes a second for you to realize that's it's because a horse is inhaling you! It's all consuming maw is agape and pulling you toward its yellow teeth and slimy plateau of a tongue. You struggle and kick, like that would help you right now. Faster and faster you approach, passing the monster's building sized incisors seconds later. You shoot back toward its wide open throat and watch the tongue lift up toward you like an airplane runway. You descend roughly and hit the back of its tongue by a stroke of luck. You bounce once and splash into a puddle, or a droplet, of spit that hasn't made it far back enough to be swallowed.

You hastily squirm out of it just in time to watch all light leave the mouth, trapping you in near total darkness as the animals lips shut. If it's any consolation, you know which way NOT to go to get out. That doesn't change the fact that the horse could swallow at any moment and be none the wiser about it eating you.

Blindly, you start to head toward the front of the Clydesdales mouth, guided only by short bursts of light when it moves it's lips around. Tiny pieces of hay still litter the tongue where saliva lakes don't. Occasionally, the horse will move its tongue and work its jaw, throwing you off your feet. Long story short, the trip is quite eventful.

When the beast again opens its mouth, you see that you are almost at the end of its tongue! Only a few hundred feet more to go! You pick up the pace, not really caring just how you're going to get out of the mouth entirely.

Light nearly blinds you now that you're so close to its source. You shield your eyes to adjust and see out into the world. The horse jerks its head hard enough to knock you off your feet and back a ways. You stare up between its huge teeth and see---
1113312211.title: Straight toward the maw of a yawning horse!

choices: You  make it back to the stable
11133122112.content:
You watch in confused awe as a horizontal metal bar is forced into the Clydesdales mouth. It passes over you like a huge space ship, coming to rest further back in the horses mouth. Through its parted lips, you make out Zimmerman's hand pushing the metal bar inside.

Suddenly, the whole tongue lurches backward and up, pinning you on your back to the sticky floor. Wet squelching sounds erupt all around you. Your world is flipped upside down as the tongue reaches for the metal bit. It slams into the top of it and drags forward, pulling you toward the bar. Helplessly, you are deposited on top of it in a thick coating of hot saliva. To you, there are earthquakes, floods, and blasts of heat. In reality, the Clydesdale is just working its jaw around the bit.

You are laying on top of the bit, your head just poking above the spit layer so you can breathe, when you feel a deep tremor, then another, then another. The horse it walking.

Unbeknownst to you, there is a person riding on this Clydesdale. A little girl, Zimmerman's niece. With her holding on, Zimmerman leads the Clydesdale out of the stable and into his front yard for a little joyride. The three of them (and the uninvited mite you are) walk all around Zimmerman's house and property, laughing and talking to each other. Eventually, you all head back to the stable.

You're too panicked to try figuring out where you are going, choosing instead to focus on the fact that each step the horse takes moves you a little closer to the edge of the bit. Below you, what little light there is reveals a slimy, roiling pink mass of muscle. You're close enough that you watch it roll back and swallow a few hundred gallons of saliva and settle back down.

Something big casts a shadow over you, even in this dark humid maw. You turn to see the front of the Clydesdale's tongue descending onto you! It easily catches you and snaps back toward the front of its mouth.

Light blinds you. You have to blink and squint in order to see the outside world, but only for an instant. In the next moment, something hits your back and drags you off the animals tongue. It's white, frothy, and holds a few small bits of hay around you: the spit on its upper lip. Both lips move around in complaint of the bit, creating more saliva froth and pushing you further up. Through a nearby bubble, you can see the stable rapidly approaching.
11133122112.title: A massive metal bridle bit passing over you!

choices: You somehow escape the mouth of the beast!
111332.content:
A mountainous muzzle descends on the straw pile you are currently on top of. You can do little else other than watch in horror as the leathery lips open to reveal an array of tower-sized teeth, then those too part, showing you it's yellow stained molars and cavernous throat. The lips then close again, enveloping you inside the maw of the horse..

The lips pull you and the straw further inside the mouth. As it begins to chew, you are flung from tooth to tongue, expecting any second to either get crushed by a tooth, or swallowed whole by the horse. What happens to you?
111332.title: A half mile wide muzzle

choices: Toward another one of the stalls
Out into the center of the stable.
1113321.content:
You are battered from every angle, never actually touching either tooth or tongue, only the straw that constantly hits you from everywhere. All of the pieces are slowly reducing in length around you, and you know what comes next.
You crash onto your stomach on a stalk of straw and there is the briefest of pauses in the behemoth's chewing. You jump on the opportunity to grab onto one of the frayed fibers of the straw and hold on for dear life. It's just big enough to straddle. You're so close to the beasts molars that you could probably jump and make it to one of them.
Suddenly, there is a light in the darkness. It shines in, momentarily blinding you and revealing the saliva-drenched chaos behind you. The horses lips have parted, and you notice that the very same piece of straw you are clinging to is hanging out. And it's moving.
The straw starts sliding out along the animals molar, so quickly that you can barely hold on to the fiber. You get closer and closer to salvation, watching the horses lips come closer and closer together. Just as you pass through them, they slam shut, pushing you just a little further away.
Now you're falling. The straw is pulling you toward the ground far faster than you would on your own, which makes holding on difficult. You release it, feeling yourself slow considerably.
A brown mass descends past you, one so massive that the air it displaces pulls you toward it and down. You watch as a great equine eye, the size of a baseball field, lowers past you. The horse takes another mouthful of straw and lifts its head back up, pulling you right into the path of its nose. It exhales, slamming a hurricane force gale at you that sends you shooting upward and outward. You sail haphazardly over the horse and...
1113321.title: You somehow escape the mouth of the beast!

choices: A trailer. Looks like you're taking a trip!
Toward another giant horse! Uh oh...
11133212.content:
The air current hits the stall door before you do. Thank goodness, because you might have been impaled by a splinter or been killed on impact of the rough wood. Instead, you loop upward, watching the floor sink beneath you, just a little. Finally, you make it up to the top of the stall door. A blast of wind from the horses breathing behind you launches you outward, into the open space of the stable.

Instantly, you can make out Zimmerman working a bridle onto the shire horse at the opposite end of the stable. They're so far away that they are somewhat blurry to you, but as the horse comes out of the stall and directly toward you, they become all to clear.

You've stopped flying around, and now your just falling slowly. The horse and its owner are coming right for you, and you can't do anything about it. As they do, their features become more clear and impressive, and horrifyingly large.

Finally, the horses head blocks almost your entire field of view. As it takes one more slow step, its head rises just a fraction and you collide with its muzzle.

You take a second to turn around in whatever crevasse you've entered. It's littered with short hairs that hold you tightly in place, so you're pretty sure your outside its mouth. Behind you, the world is moving about as fast as when you were flying all over creation, but it's controlled. You feel deep tremors in a rhythm, and see a grassy expanse through the hairs.

It hits you then, but only after a pink tsunami of muscle darts out above you and briefly covers the world: you're in a crease of its lower lip. And where is Zimmerman taking you two?
11133212.title: Out into the center of the stable.

choices: Climb down the horse to the ground
111332121.content:
You realize you might as well stay where you are since it's dangerous to climb to the ground. You sit and wait in the lip, watching as the horse is led into a dark trailer. you feel a minor shudder as the truck starts up and sets of somewhere. the rhythmic hum of the horses breathing and the darkness of the trailer make you a bit sleepy, and exhaustion does the rest.

You wake up and no longer see vastness of the trailer wall. You climb through the lip hairs to the edge and realize you are in a huge corral with eight other horses, and those are just the ones you can see. this corral dwarfs Zimmerman's stable easily! Suddenly you hear the deep squeaking sound of a gate opening. you cant immediately see the source until the horse turns its head to see it. A giant man in a cowboy hat walks over to the horse and stops only a regular foot or so from you two. his hand passes right over you and you see a ginormous red apple being offered to the horse. the horse's head tilts to meet it and You need to decide I what your going to do.
111332121.title: To the rodeo

choices: On the ground underneath the angry bull
1113321211.content:
Just before the horse grabs the apple with its large, leathery lips, you leap below the apple and onto the man's hand. As you land, you hear a loud wet crunch, and imagine how you would have fared if you stayed.

The hand is very tan and smells of leather and sweat. You start to walk now that the Apple is being pulverized between the horses giant teeth. When he pulls the hand away from the horse you almost fall off. The giant is lifting his hand up as his other hand lifts up his cowboy hat you realize he is going to scratch his head. His hand tilts forward to scratch and you tumble off, hitting many of the creases in the cowboy's hand. You plummet off the edge of his hand and are engulfed in darkness below It. You bounce off a few of the man's short hairs and land hard on his scalp. The hand lifts away a moment later and the cowboy puts his hat back on, leaving you in a shaded forest of thick black trees that are his hairs. Every step causes you to lose your balance, you lie down on the scalp and wait.

After an hour or two of waiting the hat is lifted up. You look around and see the front you run towards it. When you do a giant helmet and face cage starts to descend you realize this means he is a bull rider. You don't want to be on the bull you jump off his forehead and land.
1113321211.title: an amazing ride

choices: you make it to the animals neck
the horse is walking! where to?
the horse bucks its head, sending you flying!
1113321212.content:
The last thing you want to do is join that apple into the horse’s mouth, or go with a stranger who will only take you away from your only way back to Zimmerman’s. You nestle as far back in the lip crease as you can get as the horse lowers its head to the fruit. You brace against the hairs around you as the lips part to take the apple in. with a deafening CRUNCH, the teeth grab the apple and pull the entire thing into its mouth.

Unexpectedly, and far too quick for you to react, a tsunami of apple juice floods the crease and plucks you out of it, adding you to a river of juice dribbling down the horses chin. You struggle to free yourself, while at the same time gulping down as much of the juice as you can. It is sustenance after all.
The juice stream carries you beyond the reach of the colossal tongue and you reach out for a hair to break you free of the current. One more reaches for you, smacking you in the, well, everywhere. You bear hug it and wait for the chaos to end. You can feel the movement of the tongue above you, almost shaking you off your precarious hair.

The apple juice droplet slides away, leaving you sticky and remarkably sweet smelling, which may be a bad thing at your size. The horse swallows the apple and you watch the cowboy leave the corral. Now’s your chance. Below you is the frightening drop onto the floor of a strange corral, you climb up the hair and see that most of them are relatively horizontal. You begin jumping from one to the other toward the horse’s muscular neck.
1113321212.title: Climb down the horse to the ground

choices: You are caught by the horse
11133212123.content:
All of a sudden, you feel the horses head lift upward at a dramatic speed. So quickly, you are knocked clear off your hair, but you don't fall. As the horses head continues to rise, you follow it by its air current. you swirl beneath its chin, finally slowing as the horses head stops. Then, just as quickly, the head descends. The colossal black muzzle passes by you, and the blast of air follows, throwing you around without a care. You sail away from the horse over the door of its stall and into the scariest place you can think of: the corral hallway. Dust particles the size of your fingers occupy the space around you as you begin to settle down toward the ground. All around you, the booming knickers and grunts of other horses echo on the walls.

A distant clip clop of hooves on concrete alert you to turn around. At the other end of the corral, someone is leading another horse through the corral, and they're headed right for you. As they near and your panic rises, you can make out the hulking form of a grey Belgian horse, with the height to match the shire, but far more mass. The sound of its hooves shake the air around you, seeming to hasten your descent. No amount of flailing does you any good as...
11133212123.title: the horse bucks its head, sending you flying!

choices: You crash into a forest  of black hairs. YES!
You land in the hay beneath the horse! NOOO!
You land on... a plateau of plaid fabric?
111332121232.content:
You breathe a sigh of relief as the top of the horses massive head passes just below you. You float along with it a few feet as it moves, but it leaves you behind. You watch it leave with its owner and gently begin your descent to the ground.

Then you hear a voice you recognize. You manage to turn yourself around and see Zimmerman! Worse yet, he's getting his horse ready to move! "Zimmerman! No! Please!" You scream at the top of your lungs, desperately hoping that he could hear you. It's no use though. If he leaves, you'll probably never become normal sized again. You'd live the life of a dust particle in a corral for the rest of your life, however short it would be now.

WHOOSH! A deafening rumble and a blast of hot air hit your back like a hurricane. You launch haphazardly toward Zimmerman like a bullet, aided by a bit of condensation that stuck to you. You look back for a moment and see another horse in its stall. You must have drifted to close and it snorted. No time to care or count your blessings, as you brace for impact.
111332121232.title: The horse passes you by

choices: A cascade of great black cables: you're on the horse's rear
A mountain rising up in the distance: you're on its back.
Grey hairs too? You landed on a different horse!!!
1113321212321.content:
The snot bullet shoots you toward the horse at blinding speed. You have no control and cannot see where you landed. All you could see was black. Then the impact.

Thankfully, the capsule absorbed the lethal damage you would have taken, and even deposited you neatly on a black hair thicker than a city bus. You fight your way out of the mucus, and you're almost out when you feel a thunderous crash. You look out and see...
1113321212321.title: You crash into a forest  of black hairs. YES!

1113321213.content: You figured it was best to jump off the horse rather than hang out on its lip as it was about to eat the apple. So you jump and find yourself falling slowly through the air because of your microscopic size. As you hear the thunderous sound of the horse eating the apple it was given you were thankful you jumped. As you continued to fall you see the cowboys boots standing there and then a second pair appears next to his. You then hear above a thunderous feminine voice, you figure it is the cowboys girlfriend wishing him luck. You continued your decent towards the ground when one of the boots shifted and is now beneath you. It's to late for you to move your trajectory as you are about to fall into the opening at the top of the boot. So as your microscopic form falls into the impossibly enormous opening of the boot you don't realize the boots owner is...
1113321213.title: Trouble to boot

choices: Take a chance and wait in the boot
11133212131.content: You fall down for another minute and then you enter the boot. The first thing to hit you is the smell. it smells like leather but the smell of sweat is covering it. you finally land with a thud against the white sock that he is wearing you get up and try to look around but it's to dark to see. You lose your balence when the shoe begins to tilt for a step. You decide you need to get out of the boot before you fall underfoot. You decide to...
11133212131.title: A new prison

choices: He is sitting on his bed
He is getting on to a horse
111332121312.content:
As the cowboys foot makes impact with the ground you realize you can't take another one without falling underfoot. You run up the cowboys giant stained white sock until you get to the cowboys leg. You need to climb up his leg hair until you get to the top of the boot before you can get on his jeans because they were pulled around his cowboy boots. After an hour of climbing you get out of the terrible smelling prison and then slide down so you can climb up the jeans.

It's another few hours of climbing his jeans just to get to his belt because you have to stop every time he takes a step with that leg. When you finally reach the belt, you realize that the leather provides no good handholds. However, the stitching on it works well enough for you to wrap your arms around and hang on. You are holding on to his leather belt tightly because
111332121312.title: the tower of denim

11133213.content: A blur of brown zooms under you as your pathetically tiny body floats upwards. Before long, you slam into a massive tower, and grab onto a nearby hair. Taking a look around, you see you are clinging to a tower of flesh, with a similarly sized tower across a sea of brown hairs. You must be on its ear! Before you can catch your breath...
11133213.title: Back toward the horse

111332131.content: You watch as the other ear swivels back and forth, and quickly realize the one you're on will probably do the same. Sure enough, an earthquake rocks you as the ear swing forward, breaking your grip. You plummet yet again; this is starting to get annoying. You skim the surface of the beast's head, and watch as a "small" forest of hairs approach. Grabbing one, you look down and see a monolithic orb: its eye! That must mean you're on an eyelash! A small rumble heralds the eyelid's closure: the horse is blinking! Do you manage to hang on?
111332131.title: You are flicked off!

choices: You make it to the eyelid
1113321311.content:
The eyelid descends so quickly, that you are completely vertical, gripping an individual flake of the eyelash hair. You hold on as tightly as you can, falling faster than any other time today. You watch as another forest of thick hairs approaches from below. They collide, and you are slapped onto your stomach, thoroughly knocking the wind out of you. You feel like you've cracked a rib, or three.

No time to check, because the eyelid is lifting back up again, pinning you to the hair and worsening your already hurt chest. When the eyelid finally comes back to a resting point, you are again bounced, this time expertly landing on your feet.

You have no intention of going through that again, so you immediately start running toward the base of the eyelash, where smaller, thinner hairs, still bigger than you, dominate the area.
1113321311.title: Yes

choices: On a fence post. How lucky are you?
1113321312.content:
Suddenly, the whole top eyelid drops. You barely hold on, but the rest of your body is vertical. Air whistled past you and you can't help but scream. you look past the hair and see the bottom eyelid fast approaching. Then, just as quickly as it dropped, the eyelid stops, rocketing you downward and away from The behemoths eye. You travel down along the length of the horses face and behold the rest of the stall below him.
WHOOSH!
A minor exhale through a nostril is enough to catapult you clear out of the stall and out of the stable through its main door. Now, your new world, consisting of a fraction of Zimmerman's property, is laid out before you: the pasture, which extends into a blurry mess of green, Zimmerman's home, a building larger than any you can think of on earth, and the forest beyond, which undoubtedly holds horrors you don't want to imagine.
Without wind to shock you away, you settle down toward the ground, eventually landing...
1113321312.title: Nope, you're flung elsewhere

choices: You make it up and out of the ear
You feel the hair begin to shake.
111332132.content:
The ear snaps around, probably in response to something it hears in the distance. You are slingshotted around the ear and your grip is forced from the hair. You spun wildly and tumble down, down, down, into a pit of brown hairs sticking out horizontally from the walls. You bounce off many of them, still settling down in the deep recesses of the animals ear canal.

Finally, just before the hairless pit of the horses inner ear, you manage to hold onto one of the hairs and hug it tightly. With your legs wrapped partially around it, you look up at what you'll have to get out of. The hairs of the ear prevent you from seeing anything but white light, and you're pretty far down. You peek over the hair and behold a black abyss of hairless skin. Had you fallen down there, you'd probably never get out.

Well, there's nothing you can do now but work your way back up. Or is there?
111332132.title: You fall into the ear!

1113322.content: You finally land on solid ground: a molar the size of a stadium. You watch as, almost as if in slow motion, a piece of straw is shoved above you, and the jaws collide. You are instantly crushed, which spares you the torture of a slow digestion. Your bloody paste mixes with the straw and saliva, and provides the tiniest addition of protein to the unaware equine.
1113322.title: You have become horse feed!

info.brief_description: you are "downsized" while investigating a local farm.
info.description:
**for those adding chapters who don't have a basic account, message me if you want a third choice and I'll add it for you. Or, if you want a third option added in an existing chapter, just ask me to add it in.

**Also, if you want me to change an unused chapter option to something of your choice, just tell me which one and what to make it.

This is my first written anything, so bear with me.

To start off, You are a veterinary investigator. You take in calls of potential animal abuse and see if they are severe enough for animal rescue to come in and remove the animal. While investigating a farm with strange nighttime happenings, you find your life taking a sudden and shocking turn.

RULES: I'm going to be a killjoy...
1) be realistic. if youre a speck on the ground, animals aren't going to notice you, and if they do, wont recognize you as human.
*because it's a pain to focus on, we can ignore hunger. If you find something to eat, you can remember how hungry you are blah blah blah. Still need to drink though.

*Animals are animals. they cannot talk, they don't have human personalities and wont hunt the protagonist down because (s)he's there. Dogs might, depending on your size. And animals certainly won't do... Things... With the protagonist if they do manage to find them. Neither will people.

*the main character is not invincible. You cannot survive impossible heights on a whim. You cant just jump off something that's ten feet high when you're an inch tall and walk away without a scratch. If something like this does happen, explain how you're alive or make sure it is explained in an earlier chapter. if you take a hit that would hurt a normal person, you will be hurt, and any injuries should, at least temporarily, affect future decisions.

*Have the proper mindset: you aren't trying to live out any fantasies, but you are scared half to death most of time. its a scary place to be when you're so small and everything is so large in comparison. keep that going.

Ugh... Fine... I suppose, in an adrenaline fueled rush, all the thrill and danger can be exciting and awesome, but don't go pursuing it!

2) Be descriptive. no one sentence chapters when it can be elaborated. preferably, a 6-8 sentence paragraph minimum, but I can't fault anyone for less. The protagonist is you, so there's no need to get specific on gender, age, etc. if you are specifying the outcome, location, etc. of an event, it's okay, but don't turn that into a chain of "no" and "other." furthermore, just be creative. I know it can be hard. If you're stumped, ask yourself "what would that be like?" Three times. Works for me every time.

*I'm big on consistency in stories like this one. Please: I know can be tricky, but try to remain the same size when describing things. If we are one size, then a tooth and a paw cannot both be the size of a house, and people who frequent these kinds of stories know what I mean.

3) punctuation: Funny as it is to read, entire paragraph or more chapters that have no periods, commas, or any kind of punctuation grate against my pride as a human being. If you're going to write something, at least take the care to write it properly. Minor errors don't concern me as long as I'm not gasping for air at the end of a "sentence."

4) update 7/10/16: for those adding chapters if you want to change size after the first option to do so, you have to confront the guys in the stable. Only they can do it. For reference, look at the "you make it into the stable" chapter.

All that being said, I will allow pretty much anything, within reason...

I WILL GIVE 10,000 GP TO THE AUTHOR OF THE 250th CHAPTER!!!
